analyzed: de yang dag par sdud par byed pa dang / ston pa po dang / gnas dang / nyan pa po'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /

original: gang dag la bshad cing /
analyzed: gang dag la bshad cing /

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis brjod do //
translated: This is expressed by the words thus have I heard, up to great community of monks.

original: nyan pa la zhugs pa dag ni nyan pa po rnams so //üîΩde dag gi mthun pa'i yon tan 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: nyan pa la zhugs pa dag ni nyan pa po rnams so // de dag gi mthun pa'i yon tan 'byor pa ste /

original: mthun pa'i nyan pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i nyan pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The abundance of their good qualities is the abundance of the audience.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //

original: rtogs pa po ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa po ni ston pa ste /
translated: The teacher is the one who teaches.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: His purity is the abundance of uncommon good qualities.

original: gang gis rtogs pa dang / gang rtogs pa dang / ji ltar rtogs par bya ba de ni brtag par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs pa dang / gang rtogs pa dang / ji ltar rtogs par bya ba de ni brtag par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The thing to be examined is that by which one understands, that which is understood, and how one should understand.

original: bzhengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhengs pa ni ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù means arising from meditative concentration.

original: bstan pa ni gdags pa'i don brjod pa kun rdzob rab tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gdags pa'i don brjod pa kun rdzob rab tu bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching‚Äù means the explanation of the conventional, the expression of the meaning of designation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu dang / spyod pa rnam par dbye ba dang rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu dang / spyod pa rnam par dbye ba dang rnam pa dgu yin no //

original: da ni mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad par bya'o //

original: 'di skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dam bcas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dam bcas pa la bya ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúthus have I heard‚Äù refer to a promise.

original: kho bo cag la chos ston cig ces 'khor gyis yang dag par sdud par byed pa la gsol ba btab pa dang / de nas de bzhin no zhes dam bcas pa ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag la chos ston cig ces 'khor gyis yang dag par sdud par byed pa la gsol ba btab pa dang / de nas de bzhin no zhes dam bcas pa ste /
translated: When the assembly requested the compiler to teach the Dharma, saying ‚ÄúPlease teach us,‚Äù he promised to do so, saying ‚ÄúVery well.‚Äù

original: khyed cag gis ji skad smras pa de bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyed cag gis ji skad smras pa de bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de yang 'dod pas byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pas byas pa ma yin te /

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: because,

original: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //üîΩyang na 'di skad @77a * //
analyzed: bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas so // yang na 'di skad @77a * //

original: ces bya ba'i sgra ni dris pa'i don dag gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i sgra ni dris pa'i don dag gzhan du mi 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: Or else, the expression thus have I heard indicates that the meaning of the question is not to be changed.

original: khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin du smros shig ces byas pa dang / 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad thos pa de bzhin du smros shig ces byas pa dang / 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: bdag gis 'di skad thos kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di skad thos kyi gzhan du ma yin no //

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du thos par ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du thos par ston to //

analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas bzung ba'o //
translated: The word heard indicates that he apprehended it with the ear-consciousness.

original: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe'o //
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na / rang dbang dang ni rab sbyangs dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che tshogs pa //
analyzed: yang na / rang dbang dang ni rab sbyangs dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang bdag nyid che tshogs pa //

original: drug po rnams la legs zhes bya //
analyzed: drug po rnams la legs zhes bya //

original: don drug gi mtshan nyid kyi legs pa de la mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: don drug gi mtshan nyid kyi legs pa de la mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he possesses the excellence of the six meanings.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rang dbang tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba bag chags dang bcas pa bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das rang dbang tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba bag chags dang bcas pa bcad pa'i phyir ro //

original: rab tu sbyangs pa tshogs pa ni ye shes kyi mes shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbyangs pa tshogs pa ni ye shes kyi mes shes bya'i sgrib pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he has removed the darkness of the obscurations to the knowable with the fire of transcendent wisdom.

original: gzugs tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he possesses the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: grags pa tshogs pa ni 'gro ba thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdpal tshogs pa ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa tshogs pa ni 'gro ba thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro // dpal tshogs pa ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because his fame pervades the entire world.üîΩHe is so called because he is the support of the entire world.

original: bdag nyid chen po'i tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: bzhugs pa ni 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du spyod lam bzhi po dag gis gnas pa kun tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du spyod lam bzhi po dag gis gnas pa kun tu bstan pa'o //
translated: He is so called because he manifests the four types of correct understanding in the four modes of physical behavior, in accordance with those to be trained.

original: te zhes bya ba ni gyur zin pa ste /
analyzed: te zhes bya ba ni gyur zin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means having become,

original: ga ya na bzhugs par gyur zin to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ga ya na bzhugs par gyur zin to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: having become seated in GayƒÅ.

original: 'dis ni ga ya zhes bya ba'i yul spyir mchod rten du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ga ya zhes bya ba'i yul spyir mchod rten du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the land called GayƒÅ is a general caitya.

original: mdo 'di yul khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du bstan par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo 'di yul khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du bstan par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to express the teaching that this s≈´tra is a special land,

original: ga ya mgo'i mchod rten na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ga ya mgo'i mchod rten na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚Äúin the caitya on GayƒÅ≈õƒ´r·π£a.‚Äù

original: mgo'i sgra ni rtse mo'i sgra'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mgo'i sgra ni rtse mo'i sgra'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äú≈õƒ´r·π£a‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúpeak.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan no //
translated: It is a different nature.

original: gtso bo ni ri de la ga ya'i mgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni ri de la ga ya'i mgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The principal one is the mountain called GayƒÅ≈õƒ´r·π£a.

original: gtso bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas kyi phyir ro //
translated: The principal one is the abode of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par brjod pa de nyid kyi mchod rten du gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par brjod pa de nyid kyi mchod rten du gyur te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs abode is called a caitya.

original: mched rten smos pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: mched rten smos pa gang yin pa de /
translated: That which is called a caitya

original: sangs rgyas du ma bzhugs bzhugs pas gnas khyad zhugs pa bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas du ma bzhugs bzhugs pas gnas khyad zhugs pa bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is a special abode because many buddhas have lived there.

original: de bsnyad pa yang @77b chos kyi rnam grangs 'di sangs rgyas du mas byin gyis brlabs par thabs kyis bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsnyad pa yang @77b chos kyi rnam grangs 'di sangs rgyas du mas byin gyis brlabs par thabs kyis bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the statement of the setting is also a skillful means for explaining that this Dharma teaching is blessed by many Buddhas.

original: de bas na slob dpon gyis de la gleng gzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyis de la gleng gzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the Master says, ‚ÄúThe setting is stated in the statement, ‚ÄòThus have I heard.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: gleng gzhi'i phyogs gcig la yang gleng gzhi zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i phyogs gcig la yang gleng gzhi zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: One part of the setting should be understood as the setting.

original: mi slob pa dang / slob pas bsdus zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa dang / slob pas bsdus zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúComprised of those beyond training and those still in training‚Äù means that the great sa·πÖgha of monks is mentioned.

original: 'dir bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong smos pa'i phyir gnyis smos so //
analyzed: 'dir bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong smos pa'i phyir gnyis smos so //
translated: Here, two are mentioned because fully ordained monks are mentioned.

original: dge slong stong du tshang ba zhes 'byung ba ni mi slob pa rnams kun tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong stong du tshang ba zhes 'byung ba ni mi slob pa rnams kun tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone thousand monks in all‚Äù is for the purpose of showing those beyond training.

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pas dge slong zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pas dge slong zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are monks who have destroyed the afflictions.

original: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi bye brag go //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi bye brag go //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir work done‚Äù and so on are their distinctions.

original: de la tshig dang po'i bshad pa ni lhag mthong gi bya ba shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir bya ba rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshig dang po'i bshad pa ni lhag mthong gi bya ba shin tu rdzogs pa'i phyir bya ba rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The first phrase is explained as ‚Äúthe act is completed‚Äù because the act of insight is completely finished.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs su gtogs par blta'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs su gtogs par blta'o //
translated: Insight should be regarded as a synonym for wisdom.

original: byed pa byas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe act is done‚Äù because the act of concentration is completely finished.

original: de ni bya ba zin pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: de ni bya ba zin pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúthe act is done.‚Äù

original: lhag mthong gi bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum spangs pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum spangs pa ste /
translated: The act of insight is the abandonment of the three kinds of afflictions.

original: de ni khur bor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis ston to //
analyzed: de ni khur bor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis ston to //
translated: That is shown by the three phrases beginning with ‚Äúthe burden is cast off.‚Äù

original: bor ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis phung po lnga'i khur bor ba ste /
analyzed: bor ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis phung po lnga'i khur bor ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCast off‚Äù means that they have cast off the burden of the five aggregates.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye ba med pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye ba med pas de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since they will not be reborn in the future, they are called that.

original: de'i bshad pa ni khur blangs pa bor ba ste khur de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni khur blangs pa bor ba ste khur de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe burden is cast off‚Äù and ‚Äúthe burden‚Äù is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'dis ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the abandonment of the defilement of life.

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The phrase having attained his own goal means the abandonment of the defilement of the passions.

original: de'i bshad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is having realized the state of an Arhat.

original: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis las gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su zad par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par spyor ro //
analyzed: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis las gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su zad par zhes bya bar tshig rnam par spyor ro //
translated: The phrase having exhausted the cankers means that he has exhausted the cankers by which he would have had to transmigrate in the three realms.

original: de'i bshad pa ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of this is having emerged from the three realms.

original: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs par bstan to //
translated: This shows the abandonment of the defilement of action.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gang gis shes rab kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum zad pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /üîΩde dag gis de bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gang gis shes rab kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum zad pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste /üîΩde dag gis de bstan to //
translated: The phrase his mind is liberated by perfect knowledge means that he has the perfect knowledge which is the cause for the destruction of the three kinds of defilement of wisdom.üîΩThis is explained by the phrase he has attained the destruction of defilements and the attainment of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag bsgoms pa ste /
translated: Right knowledge is the cultivation of right instruction.

original: des @78a * //
analyzed: des @78a * //
translated: By means of that,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe dag las gang dag gis sems shin tu rnam par grol ba de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe dag las gang dag gis sems shin tu rnam par grol ba de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: he is liberated from the afflictions, actions, and rebirths, and his mind is completely liberated.

original: de'i bshad pa ni ma nor ba'i gdams ngag bsgoms te de la gnas nas nyon mongs pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni ma nor ba'i gdams ngag bsgoms te de la gnas nas nyon mongs pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚Äúhaving cultivated the unerring instruction, having abided in that, he has completely abandoned the afflictions.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe la bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe la bya bar 'dod de /
translated: Here, ‚Äúafflictions‚Äù is asserted to refer to the afflictions, actions, and rebirths.

original: 'dis nyon mongs par byed pa dang / 'dir nyon mongs par byed pa ste sgrub pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs par byed pa dang / 'dir nyon mongs par byed pa ste sgrub pa gnyis so //
translated: It is an affliction because it afflicts, and it is an affliction because it is afflicted, and it is an affliction because it is to be afflicted, and it is an affliction because it afflicts.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba rab tu ston te /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba rab tu ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving attained the perfection of mastery over all mental states‚Äù shows the function of samƒÅdhi.

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dbang sgyur ba ni sems la dbang ba dag ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dbang sgyur ba ni sems la dbang ba dag ste /
translated: Mastery over the mind is the mental states.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: They are samƒÅdhis.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mchog ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mchog ste /
translated: The supreme of those who have attained mastery over all mental states are the arhats.

original: de thob pa dag go //
analyzed: de thob pa dag go //
translated: They are the ones who have attained the supreme.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa shin tu bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúwho have cultivated the bases of supernatural powers well.‚Äù

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: The bases of supernatural powers are the meditative concentrations.

original: de dag shin tu bsgoms pas dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag shin tu bsgoms pas dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'i 'os su gyur pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa rnams so //
translated: Because they have cultivated those well, they are arhats who are worthy of receiving gifts of faith.

original: de ni dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'i 'os su gyur pas zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa'i 'os su gyur pas zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúwho are worthy of receiving gifts of faith.‚Äù

original: slob pa rnams kyi tshad ni mdo las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob pa rnams kyi tshad ni mdo las mi 'byung ste /
translated: The measure of the learners is not mentioned in the sutra.

original: bshad pa byed pas bslab pa'i sgra don gyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas bslab pa'i sgra don gyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThe two types of learners are mentioned by the word ‚Äòlearners‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: bslab pa ma rdzogs pa zhes bya bas ni rgyu yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bslab pa ma rdzogs pa zhes bya bas ni rgyu yongs su ma rdzogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhose training is incomplete‚Äù indicates that the cause is incomplete.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su ma rdzogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Because the desired aim is not fully accomplished means that the result is not fully accomplished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni de dag pas grangs mang ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni de dag pas grangs mang ba'o //
translated: A great many bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas means that they are more numerous than those.

original: byang chub tu smon lam btab pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' dag go //
analyzed: byang chub tu smon lam btab pa'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' dag go //
translated: They are bodhisattvas because they have made aspirations for enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po dag go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po dag go //
translated: They are mahƒÅsattvas because they accomplish the aims of all sentient beings.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su brjod do //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su brjod do //
translated: From there, etc. describes the samƒÅdhi.

original: de la de nas zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la de nas zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad pa'o //
translated: There, from there means without interruption.

original: gcig pu ni sku dben pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu ni sku dben pa'o //
translated: Alone means physical seclusion.

original: dben par gshegs pa ni thugs dben pa'o //
analyzed: dben par gshegs pa ni thugs dben pa'o //
translated: Going to seclusion means mental seclusion.

original: nang du yang dag gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nang du yang dag gzhag pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Correct placement within means entering into the samƒÅdhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: That samƒÅdhi is focused on suchness.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid la btags te zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid la btags te zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: It is designated in the realm of phenomena.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes rang gis rig @78b pa nyid chos kyi dbyings la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes rang gis rig @78b pa nyid chos kyi dbyings la rtog pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that is free from all elaborations, which is self-awareness itself, is the realization of the realm of phenomena.

original: de nyid dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the samƒÅdhi that is without reference points.

original: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin yongs su brjod ce na /
translated: Why is samƒÅdhi described?

original: bshad pa byed pas de la ting nge 'dzin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas de la ting nge 'dzin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir dgos pa bstan to //
translated: The author of the commentary teaches that here the purpose is shown by the words ‚ÄúsamƒÅdhi is . . .‚Äù

original: brtag par bya ba'i dngos po ste zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba'i dngos po ste zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The thing to be investigated is the realm of phenomena.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin so so rang gis rig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin so so rang gis rig pa nyid de /
translated: That is the samƒÅdhi that is self-awareness.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni rtog ge'i yul ma yin zhes de skad smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni rtog ge'i yul ma yin zhes de skad smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe realm of phenomena is not the domain of sophistry.‚Äù

original: don 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba don gyi skabs 'dir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba don gyi skabs 'dir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis meaning‚Äù is emptiness. ‚ÄúIn this context‚Äù means in the context of the meaning of emptiness, which is suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suchness is not the object of the disciples and so on, because it is the aspect of the selflessness of all things.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni stong pa nyid kun tu brjod pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni stong pa nyid kun tu brjod pas so //
translated: By this means by the expression of emptiness.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is emptiness.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi'o //
translated: Theirs refers to the disciples and so on.

original: stong pa nyid ma mthong bar nyon mongs pa spong ba med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ma mthong bar nyon mongs pa spong ba med de /
translated: Without seeing emptiness, the afflictions cannot be eliminated.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid ni de dag gi yul yang yin te /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid ni de dag gi yul yang yin te /
translated: Emptiness in the aspect of the selflessness of the person is their object,

original: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the aspect of the selflessness of things.

original: bdag gis byang chub ni thob ces bya ba nas bzung ste rtog pa po rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub ni thob ces bya ba nas bzung ste rtog pa po rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: From I have attained enlightenment up to the one who imagines is purified shows the purification of the one who imagines.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la 'di mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la 'di mi srid kyi /
translated: This is not possible for one who abides in the samadhi that takes suchness as its object.

original: de las bzhengs pa la 'di rigs te 'og tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzhengs pa la 'di rigs te 'og tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: It is possible for one who has arisen from that, and will be established later.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na ji ltar mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ji ltar bzhengs she na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na ji ltar mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ji ltar bzhengs she na /
translated: If the Lord is always of the nature of nondual intuition, how is he in meditative concentration and how does he arise?

original: de'ang 'og tu brjod par bya'o //üîΩbyang chub brnyes par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byang chub ni thob ces mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'ang 'og tu brjod par bya'o // byang chub brnyes par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gis byang chub ni thob ces mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This will be explained later.üîΩThe attainment of enlightenment is taught in the sutra, ‚ÄúI have attained enlightenment.‚Äù

original: ye shes thugs su chud pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ye shes ni khong du chud ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes thugs su chud pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ye shes ni khong du chud ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intuition is realized is taught in the sutra, ‚ÄúI have realized intuition.‚Äù

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the intuition free from all conceptual elaboration.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa nyid byang chub brnyes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa nyid byang chub brnyes par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the realization of such an intuition should be understood as the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mtshungs mnyam pas thub pa'i byang chub brnyes pa khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mtshungs mnyam pas thub pa'i byang chub brnyes pa khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: Thus, the attainment of the Sage‚Äôs enlightenment is superior because of the equality of the object and the subject.

original: de ni ye shes thugs su chud pas bye brag tu gyur to zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni ye shes thugs su chud pas bye brag tu gyur to zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúit is distinguished by the realization of intuition.‚Äù

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don thabs dang bcas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bya ba ni byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don thabs dang bcas pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bya ba ni byas pa'o //
translated: The performance of the task is completed in order to accomplish the benefit of self and the benefit of others together with the means.

original: de'i bshad pa ni dam bcas pa nyams su len zhes bya ba @79a * //üîΩla sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni dam bcas pa nyams su len zhes bya ba @79a * // la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe practice of the vow,‚Äù etc.

original: bya ba ni byas zhes pa'i tshig gis ni de'i bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni byas zhes pa'i tshig gis ni de'i bstan pa'o //
translated: The performance of the task is completed by the words ‚Äúthe performance of the task is completed.‚Äù

original: mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams ni de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig lhag ma rnams ni de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The remaining words of the verse are the explanation of that.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the benefit of self is included in the perfection of abandonment and intuition.

original: de la spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni bdag gis khur ni bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis bsnyad de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnas dang bcas pa spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni bdag gis khur ni bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis bsnyad de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnas dang bcas pa spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of abandonment is indicated by the three words ‚ÄúI have cast off the burden,‚Äù etc., because it shows the abandonment of the addictive and objective obscurations together with their instincts.

original: khams gsum du skye bas bsdus pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dag ni khur blangs pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum du skye bas bsdus pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dag ni khur blangs pa ste /
translated: The aggregates, which are the nature of the maturation of birth in the three realms, are the burden, because they are the imagined characteristic.

original: de dag spangs pa'i phyir khur bor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i phyir khur bor ba'o //
translated: The one who has abandoned them is the one who has laid down the burden.

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas skye ba spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas skye ba spangs par bstan to //
translated: This shows the abandonment of the abode of birth, which is the obscuration of affliction and the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de'i bshad pa ni khur blangs pa bor zhes ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni khur blangs pa bor zhes ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúhaving laid down the burden.‚Äù

original: khur gyi don ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni khur de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: khur gyi don ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni khur de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The meaning of the burden is as before, because it is explained that the burden is the five aggregates of clinging.

original: / bdag gis na 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las ni brgal zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: / bdag gis na 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa las ni brgal zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúI have crossed over the wilderness of cyclic existence‚Äù shows the abandonment of the obscuration of affliction.

original: 'dis 'khor bar byed pas 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'khor bar byed pas 'khor ba ste /
translated: It is cyclic existence because it causes one to cycle.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is the mass of afflictions such as attachment.

original: de nyid 'brog dgon pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'brog dgon pa ste /
translated: That itself is the wilderness.

original: de'i bshad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe extreme abandonment of the afflictive obstructions.‚Äù

original: bdag gis ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI have removed ignorance‚Äù is non-afflictive non-knowing.

original: de bsal ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The removal of that is abandonment.

original: 'dis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de'i bshad pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe extreme abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience.‚Äù

original: bdag gis rig pa ni bsgrubs zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: bdag gis rig pa ni bsgrubs zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúI have accomplished knowledge‚Äù teaches the perfection of exalted wisdom.

original: shes bya thams cad la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the exalted wisdom that observes all objects of knowledge.

original: de'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbdag gis zug rdu ni phyung zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni lta ba thams cad kyi zug rdu bton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du byas pa zhes bya'o // bdag gis zug rdu ni phyung zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni lta ba thams cad kyi zug rdu bton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe direct realization of all phenomena just as they are.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI have removed the splinters‚Äù teaches the removal of the splinters of all views.

original: bdag gis srid pa ni zad ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gis srid pa ni zad ces bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI have exhausted existence‚Äù teaches the exhaustion of the afflictive obstructions.

original: smon lam dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smon lam dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The third is called ‚Äúdevoid of aspiration.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: sred pa'i don du tshol ba'i smon lam mo //
analyzed: sred pa'i don du tshol ba'i smon lam mo //
translated: The aspiration is the aspiration for the search for craving.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa nyid lta ba dang sred pa spangs par grub mod kyi so sor smos pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu 'byung bas lta ba dang sred pa gnyis gtso bor @79b gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa nyid lta ba dang sred pa spangs par grub mod kyi so sor smos pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu 'byung bas lta ba dang sred pa gnyis gtso bor @79b gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of the obscurations of the afflictions is established by the abandonment of views and craving, but they are mentioned separately because views and craving are predominant due to their continuous occurrence.

original: 'dis ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of one's own aim.

original: bdag gis chos kyi gru ni spyar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni chos kyi gru'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos kyi gru ni spyar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni chos kyi gru'o //
translated: The ship of the Dharma is the wisdom that is uncontaminated and focuses on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de'i bshad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab yang dag par bsgrubs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab yang dag par bsgrubs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is the accomplishment of supramundane wisdom.

original: bdag gis chos kyi rnga ni brdungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thabs dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gis chos kyi rnga ni brdungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa thabs dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: The words I have beaten the drum of the Dharma and so on show the perfection of others' aims together with the means.

original: de la thabs ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de la thabs ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'o //
translated: The means is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de yang bdag gis chos kyi rnga ni brdungs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang bdag gis chos kyi rnga ni brdungs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: And that is indicated by ‚ÄúI have beaten the Dharma drum.‚Äù

original: de'i bshad pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe turning of the wheel of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: nges par legs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu rab tu bshad pas gsung rab kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: nges par legs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu rab tu bshad pas gsung rab kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma of the scriptures is twofold, the cause of definite goodness and the cause of high status, because it is the teaching of the causes of both.

original: de la nges par legs pa'i rgyu ni stong pa nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la nges par legs pa'i rgyu ni stong pa nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: The cause of definite goodness is the teaching of emptiness.

original: de yang bdag gis chos kyi dung ni bus zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang bdag gis chos kyi dung ni bus zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: And that is indicated by ‚ÄúI have blown the Dharma conch.‚Äù

original: de'i bshad pa ni bdag med pa'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni bdag med pa'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe proclamation of the sound of selflessness.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba ni dngos po stobs kyis byung ba'i tshad mas grogs su gyur pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon pa yin pas bdag gis chos kyi rgyal mtshan ni bsgreng zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba ni dngos po stobs kyis byung ba'i tshad mas grogs su gyur pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba thams cad zil gyis gnon pa yin pas bdag gis chos kyi rgyal mtshan ni bsgreng zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The view of emptiness is the view that overcomes all opponents because it is the valid knowledge that arises by the power of things. Therefore, ‚ÄúI have raised the Dharma victory banner.‚Äù

original: mu stegs thams cad las rnam par rgyal bas rgyal mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mu stegs thams cad las rnam par rgyal bas rgyal mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is a victory banner because it is victorious over all the tirthikas.

original: bdag med pa'i sgra gsang bstod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i sgra gsang bstod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a victory banner because it is victorious over all the tirthikas.

original: de'i bshad pa ni phyir rgol ba shin tu tshar bcad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni phyir rgol ba shin tu tshar bcad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its commentary is called the Thoroughly Subjugating of Opponents.

original: bdag gi 'khor ba'i lugs ni bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gdul ba tha dad pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa tha dad par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khor ba'i lugs ni bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gdul ba tha dad pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa tha dad par bstan to //
translated: By the lines beginning I will reverse the current of my cyclic existence, and so on, he teaches the perfection of the aims of others, which is different from the other different disciples.

original: gdul ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gdul ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of disciples:

original: don grub pa dang / de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: don grub pa dang / de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: those who have accomplished their aims and those who have not.

original: don grub pa ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: don grub pa ni kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa ste /
translated: Those who have accomplished their aims are those who have abandoned all the fetters.

original: de'i ched du bdag gi 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'khor bar 'dren pa dang / thob par byed pas 'khor ba'i lugs so //
analyzed: de'i ched du bdag gi 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'khor bar 'dren pa dang / thob par byed pas 'khor ba'i lugs so //
translated: For their sake, he says, I will reverse the current of my cyclic existence, and so on.

original: kun tu sbyor ba ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: The current of cyclic existence is the flow of cyclic existence, which leads one into cyclic existence and causes one to attain it.üîΩ Fetters are bonds.

original: de bdag gis bzlog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bdag gis bzlog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I will reverse them is what it means.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rkyen kun tu sbyor ba mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rkyen kun tu sbyor ba mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe non-occurrence of the conditions of the fetters.‚Äù

original: kun tu sbyor ba nyid skye ba'i rkyen dag ste /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba nyid skye ba'i rkyen dag ste /
translated: The fetters themselves are the conditions of birth.

original: de dag mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They do not occur, is what is meant.

original: don ma grub pa ni kun tu sbyor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'o //üîΩde yang rnam @80a * //
analyzed: don ma grub pa ni kun tu sbyor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'o // de yang rnam @80a * //
translated: The unaccomplished aim is the non-abandonment of all the fetters.

original: pa gnyis te /
analyzed: pa gnyis te /
translated: That is also of two kinds.

original: so so'i skye bo lung gi stobs can dang / khong du chud pa'i stobs can de kho na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo lung gi stobs can dang / khong du chud pa'i stobs can de kho na mthong ba'o //
translated: The ordinary person is of the power of scripture, and the one who sees reality is of the power of understanding.

original: dang po'i ched du bdag gis chos kyi lugs ni bsnyad ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dang po'i ched du bdag gis chos kyi lugs ni bsnyad ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For the first, it is said, ‚ÄúI have taught the system of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: nga'i chos kyi lugs ni mang du thos pa rnams kyis bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga'i chos kyi lugs ni mang du thos pa rnams kyis bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The system of my Dharma is explained by those of much learning, is what is meant.

original: chos rnams kyi lugs ni tshul lo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi lugs ni tshul lo //
translated: The system of the dharmas is the way.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni drug dang ji ltar mthun par gzhag ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni drug dang ji ltar mthun par gzhag ste /
translated: The defiled and undefiled dharmas are established in six ways, as appropriate.

original: tshul drug ni /
analyzed: tshul drug ni /
translated: The six ways are:

original: de kho na don gyi tshul dang / thob pa'i tshul dang / bstan pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de kho na don gyi tshul dang / thob pa'i tshul dang / bstan pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The way of the meaning of reality, the way of attainment, the way of teaching, the way of avoiding the two extremes, the way of the inconceivable, and the way of intention.

original: de'i bshad pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos yang dag par bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called ‚Äúthe correct explanation of mundane and supramundane dharmas.‚Äù

original: khong du chud pa'i stobs can gyi ched du bdag gis lam ngan pa ni bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i stobs can gyi ched du bdag gis lam ngan pa ni bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs te /
translated: For the sake of those who have the power of understanding, two verses are stated beginning with ‚ÄúI have cut off the bad paths.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa dag ni lam ngan pa dag go //
analyzed: phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa dag ni lam ngan pa dag go //
translated: Those who are attached to error are on bad paths.

original: 'dul ba rnams kyis de dag ni ngas bcad de /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams kyis de dag ni ngas bcad de /
translated: Those who are to be disciplined have had those cut off by me.

original: sems can la bstan pas so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la bstan pas so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: I have taught them to sentient beings, is what is intended.

original: de bas na bdag gis lam ni kun tu bstan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis lam ni kun tu bstan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is stated: ‚ÄúI have revealed the path everywhere.‚Äù

original: tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of these two verses is: abandoning adherence to error, and being in accord with the eightfold noble path.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: In order,

original: de dag ni skye bo nges par legs pa'i snod kyi ched du gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skye bo nges par legs pa'i snod kyi ched du gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the teaching of the perfection of the benefit of others for the sake of the vessel of the definite goodness of beings.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i snod kyi ched du bdag gis zhing ngan pa dag ni rnam par bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i snod kyi ched du bdag gis zhing ngan pa dag ni rnam par bzlog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For the sake of the vessel of the higher realms, he says, I will turn away from bad fields, and so on.

original: zhing dang zhing ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes par gyur na zhing ma yin pa 'dor te /
analyzed: zhing dang zhing ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes par gyur na zhing ma yin pa 'dor te /
translated: When one has understood the distinction between fields and non-fields, one abandons the non-fields.

original: zhing la mngon par mtho ba'i sa bon 'debs pas mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob po //
analyzed: zhing la mngon par mtho ba'i sa bon 'debs pas mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa 'thob po //
translated: Since one plants the seed of the higher realms in the field, one obtains the fruit of the higher realms, which is especially exalted.

original: tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa ni mu stegs can zhing ngan pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / bsod nams kyi zhing dkon mchog gsum kun tu bstan pas na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kyi bshad pa ni mu stegs can zhing ngan pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / bsod nams kyi zhing dkon mchog gsum kun tu bstan pas na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of these two phrases is: ‚Äúin order to turn away the bad fields of the tƒ´rthikas and in order to reveal the three jewels, the field of merit.‚Äù

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is in that order.

original: chos de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub la'o //
analyzed: chos de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that Dharma‚Äù refers to enlightenment.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o // gang gis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow‚Äù refers to the mode.üîΩ‚ÄúBy whom‚Äù refers to the agent.

original: sus zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: sus zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWho‚Äù refers to the agent.

original: de'i bshad pa ni de la brtag par bya ba'i dngos @80b po ni gang gis gang zhig ji ltar khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni de la brtag par bya ba'i dngos @80b po ni gang gis gang zhig ji ltar khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚ÄúIn that, the thing to be investigated is ‚Äòby whom, what, and how is it understood?‚Äô‚Äù

original: de la gang gis zhes bya bas ni byed pa dang byed pa po ston to //
analyzed: de la gang gis zhes bya bas ni byed pa dang byed pa po ston to //
translated: There, ‚Äúby whom‚Äù shows the agent and the instrument.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù is what is to be understood.

original: byang chub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúenlightenment.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHow‚Äù is the mode.

original: sus byang chub la byed pa po dang / byed pa la sogs pa kun brtags nas byang chub khong du chud pa ston to //
analyzed: sus byang chub la byed pa po dang / byed pa la sogs pa kun brtags nas byang chub khong du chud pa ston to //
translated: Who, having imagined an agent, action, etc. with regard to enlightenment, demonstrates the comprehension of enlightenment?

original: 'di ni de'i kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This is its imagined nature.

original: de dag ni kun tu brtags pa yin pas dus gsum du yang rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni kun tu brtags pa yin pas dus gsum du yang rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Since they are imagined, they should be understood as essenceless in all three times.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus dang sems kyis ni khong du chud par mi rigs so zhes mdo las gsungs pas ;
analyzed: lus dang sems kyis ni khong du chud par mi rigs so zhes mdo las gsungs pas ;
translated: Because it is said in the sutra, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable to comprehend with body or mind.‚Äù

original: bdag la sogs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by self, etc.

original: de bas na lus dang sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúneither with body nor mind,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ma bzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa rnams shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ma bzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since the imagined selves, etc. of the heterodox are not at all perceived, they are not posited. This is the meaning.

original: lus ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du med du zin kyang de ltar gyur ba rnam par shes pa snang ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lus ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du med du zin kyang de ltar gyur ba rnam par shes pa snang ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Although the body does not exist as an entity of subtle atoms, it is established by the power of the appearance of consciousness in that way.

original: bems po g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: bems po g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúinsentient and unmoving‚Äù has the same meaning.

original: de'i bshad pa ni spyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni spyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúwithout activity.‚Äù

original: yul khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it lacks activity that has the characteristic of comprehending objects.

original: rtsva dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni kun tu brtags pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsva dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni kun tu brtags pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúlike grass, trees, and so on‚Äù is ‚Äúarising from imagination.‚Äù

original: dper na rtsva la sogs pa phyi rol na med kyang rnam par shes pas yongs su brtags pa tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa ltar lus kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsva la sogs pa phyi rol na med kyang rnam par shes pas yongs su brtags pa tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa ltar lus kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as grass and so on are established as mere imaginations by consciousness, even though they do not exist externally, the body is also like that.

original: sems med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúwithout mind‚Äù is ‚Äúwithout ideation.‚Äù

original: 'di yang g-yo ba med pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang g-yo ba med pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: This also proves that it is unmoving.

original: rkyen rnams tshogs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba de ni 'dir 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams tshogs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba de ni 'dir 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúarises from the assemblage of conditions‚Äù is ‚Äúarises from the four great elements‚Äù here.

original: de'i rnam par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las byung ba'i lus zhes rnam par gzhag par zad la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las byung ba'i lus zhes rnam par gzhag par zad la /
translated: It is merely posited that the body arises from the four great elements by the power of the error of its transformation.

original: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'khrul pa yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i byang chub kyi gnas skabs na med na lus lta byang chub khong du chud pa'i byed pa por ga la 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa 'khrul pa yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i byang chub kyi gnas skabs na med na lus lta byang chub khong du chud pa'i byed pa por ga la 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If the error of the great elements, etc., does not exist in the state of enlightenment, free from all conceptualization, how could the body be the agent who understands enlightenment?

original: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las byung ba zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'dir yang gong du bshad ma thag pa @81a * //
analyzed: pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las byung ba zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba ste / 'dir yang gong du bshad ma thag pa @81a * //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúarises from the impure substances of the parents‚Äù is ‚Äúfrom impure substances.‚Äù

original: nyid dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyid dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here also, the intention is the same as what was just explained above.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ther zug ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ther zug ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is ‚Äúnot enduring.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this.

original: gnyis las rnam par dben pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis las rnam par dben pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Suchness is devoid of duality.

original: de ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: It is unchanging.

original: de yang 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis 'dzin te /
analyzed: de yang 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis 'dzin te /
translated: And that is apprehended by the knowledge of the unchangeability of suchness.

original: de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of the nature of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin du zin kyang de rtag tu 'dra ba'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid kyis skad cig pa yin du zin kyang de rtag tu 'dra ba'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Even though the knowledge of the Tathagata is momentary by nature, it is established as unchanging because it is always the same.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i lus ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i lus ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The body, which is created by karma and the afflictions, is not like that.

original: rtag tu bsku ba dang / bkru ba dang / mnye dgos pa dang zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis bsgrims te yongs su bskyang dgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bsku ba dang / bkru ba dang / mnye dgos pa dang zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis bsgrims te yongs su bskyang dgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúalways requiring anointing, bathing, and massaging‚Äù is ‚Äúrequiring natural care.‚Äù

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúby the nature of destruction.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig pa dang sbyar te bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig pa dang sbyar te bstan to //
translated: Impermanence is taught in connection with momentariness.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ni rgyu dang sbyar te bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ni rgyu dang sbyar te bstan to //
translated: The nature of destruction is taught in connection with the cause.

original: log par snang bas gnyis su med pa la gnyis su snang ba'i phyir rnam pa de'i byis pa rnams rmongs par byed de /
analyzed: log par snang bas gnyis su med pa la gnyis su snang ba'i phyir rnam pa de'i byis pa rnams rmongs par byed de /
translated: Because of the appearance of duality in the non-dual, through the appearance of the unreal, the childish are deluded by that aspect.

original: sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The mind is like an illusion. This is the explanation of that.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced by meritorious and non-meritorious karma.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rkyen las byung ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rkyen las byung ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by arising from the conditions of virtue and non-virtue.

original: gcig la dmigs pa'i gzhi ni gnas te /
analyzed: gcig la dmigs pa'i gzhi ni gnas te /
translated: The basis of observation in one is the abode.

original: de med pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no abode.

original: de ni gnas pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gnas pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by abiding.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gis bdag nyid kyi sems kyi dbang du byas nas tshig gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gis bdag nyid kyi sems kyi dbang du byas nas tshig gsum gsungs so //
translated: That is spoken of in three verses, taking into consideration the nature of one's own mind, which is dependent on another.

original: byang chub kyi gnas skabs na ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sems med na gang gis de de'i khong du chud par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi gnas skabs na ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sems med na gang gis de de'i khong du chud par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of enlightenment, if there were no such mind, by what would one understand that?

original: brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In terms of the imagined, he said ‚Äúwithout characteristics.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: The absence of the existence of characteristics is ‚Äúwithout characteristics.‚Äù

original: med par dgag pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: med par dgag pa rtsom mo //
translated: He begins the negation of non-existence.

original: de'i brtag pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i brtag pa ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its investigation is called ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of the imagined characteristic.‚Äù

original: yongs su grub pa'i phyir yul ma yin zhe na /üîΩdngos po med pa /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i phyir yul ma yin zhe na / dngos po med pa /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not an object of the perfected?‚ÄùüîΩHe said ‚Äúnon-entity.‚Äù

original: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-entity‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout covering.‚Äù

original: 'di la kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pas dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la kun brtags pa'i dngos po med pas dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no imagined entity here, it is ‚Äúnon-entity.‚Äù

original: yongs su grub pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the perfected,

original: 'dir bla gab @81b med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bla gab @81b med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to being without covering.

original: 'di ni 'di skad du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di skad du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: This is to be explained as follows: The wisdom that is isolated from the duality of the grasped and the grasper is similar to space.

original: byang chub kyang ye shes de nyid yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang ye shes de nyid yin no //
translated: And enlightenment is just that wisdom.

original: de bas na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir khong du chud pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i dngos po med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir khong du chud pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i dngos po med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference, it is taught that there is no object of understanding and no understanding.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba dang / ring du song bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba dang / ring du song bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúempty of an inherent nature‚Äù and ‚Äúgone to the far shore.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la sgro btags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the nature that is superimposed on the perfected nature, which is the nature that is the essence of things, is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dis ni dngos po med pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po med pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of non-entityness.

original: ring du song bas zhes bya bas ni sems nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: ring du song bas zhes bya bas ni sems nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúGone to the far shore‚Äù teaches that the mind is of the nature of space.

original: dper na nam mkha' chod pa med par thams cad du song ba ltar sems kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' chod pa med par thams cad du song ba ltar sems kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as space is unobstructed and has gone everywhere, so also is the mind.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reality of thusness.

original: 'dis ni bla gab med pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bla gab med pa'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of ‚Äúwithout shelter.‚Äù

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúawakening, etc.,‚Äù

original: byang chub ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: awakening is twofold:

original: so so rang gis rig pa dang ; sgras brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa dang ; sgras brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: that which is to be individually realized and that which is expressed by words.

original: de la sgras brjod par bya ba ni tha snyad tsam ma gtogs par ci yang med na de khong du chud par bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la sgras brjod par bya ba ni tha snyad tsam ma gtogs par ci yang med na de khong du chud par bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the latter is nothing but a mere convention, how can it be realized?

original: so so rang gis rig pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is to be individually realized is the nature of gnosis.

original: de la yang khong du chud par bya ba dang / khong du chud pa yod par ga la 'gyur ;üîΩming tsam tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni byang chub rnam pa gnyis po de ston te /
analyzed: de la yang khong du chud par bya ba dang / khong du chud pa yod par ga la 'gyur ; ming tsam tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni byang chub rnam pa gnyis po de ston te /
translated: How can there be anything to be realized in that, or anyone who realizes it?üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúmere name, mere convention‚Äù teaches both of these aspects of awakening.

original: ming 'di gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid ming gi sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: ming 'di gzugs med pa'i phung po rnams so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid ming gi sgrar bstan to //
translated: The nondual gnosis itself is taught by the term ‚Äúname,‚Äù because it is said that ‚Äúthis name is the formless aggregates.‚Äù

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam nyid byang chub ste /
translated: The mere nondual wisdom is enlightenment.üîΩ

original: de las gud na med do //
analyzed: de las gud na med do //
translated: Awakening is just the nondual intuition, and there is nothing else apart from that.

original: 'dis ni so so rang gis rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni so so rang gis rig pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the individual intuitive wisdom.

original: tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni sgras brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni sgras brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase merely a convention means that it is expressed by words.

original: de'i bshad pa ni de la khong du chud par bya ba'i don ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni de la khong du chud par bya ba'i don ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: One should know that the imagined nature does not exist, because the object to be understood is merely a name and a convention.

original: ming dang tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni ming tsam tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming dang tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba ni ming tsam tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase merely a name and a convention means merely a name and merely a convention.

original: nam ming tsam du gyur ba de'i tshe 'di skad du 'di la ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba med do zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: nam ming tsam du gyur ba de'i tshe 'di skad du 'di la ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin 'gyur ba med do zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: When it is merely a name, then one should explain that there is no change in the imagined nature in this case.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe tha snyad tsam du zad pas de'i tshe 'byung ba med pa tsam ni 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin mi 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe tha snyad tsam du zad pas de'i tshe 'byung ba med pa tsam ni 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the imagined nature is when it is merely a convention. At that time, the mere non-occurrence is the non-occurrence.

original: gcig nas gcig @82a * //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig @82a * //
translated: from one to another.

original: tu brgyud de sgra skad kyi gnas su gyur pa log pa'i dngos po de la sgra skad med pas sgra skad med pa'o //
analyzed: tu brgyud de sgra skad kyi gnas su gyur pa log pa'i dngos po de la sgra skad med pas sgra skad med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no sound in that unreal thing which is the basis of sound, it is said to be without sound.

original: de yang tha snyad tsam la brten nas bstan te /
analyzed: de yang tha snyad tsam la brten nas bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught in dependence on mere convention.

original: de'i bshad pa ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúnon-existent thing.‚Äù

original: dpyad pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dpyad pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: Examination is conceptualization.

original: de'i yul ma yin pas dpyad du med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pas dpyad du med pa ste /
translated: Since it is not the object of that, it is not to be examined.

original: de ni rtog ge'i yul las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rtog ge'i yul las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: It is explained as ‚Äúcompletely beyond the domain of sophistry.‚Äù

original: chos rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin las dben pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin las dben pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe dharmas are empty by nature‚Äù means that they are isolated from the imagined nature.

original: de ni grub pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni grub pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ste /
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúestablished.‚Äù

original: de la gzung ba'am 'dzin pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'am 'dzin pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the apprehended and the apprehender are not established.

original: rgyu ba med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba med pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout movement‚Äù is because of the absence of signs.

original: 'jug pa med pa ni byis pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ni byis pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout engagement‚Äù is because of completely transcending the domain of fools.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa 'di yul las kyang shin tu 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa 'di yul las kyang shin tu 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is the knowledge of the noble ones, together with its aspects, is also beyond the object.

original: rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is non-cognition.

original: gdags pa'i gnas gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa'i gnas gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is free from the superimposition of the apprehended and the apprehender, the basis of designation, it is not something to be designated.

original: de'i phyir gnas med pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as baseless.

original: 'ong ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Coming is arising.

original: 'gro ba ni 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'gag pa ste /
translated: Going is cessation.

original: de dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bos gang la chad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bos gang la chad pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is cut off by the imagined nature is called that.

original: de'i bshad pa ni ma skyes ma 'gags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni ma skyes ma 'gags zhes bya'o //
translated: Its explanation is called unborn and unceasing.

original: gdags pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni tha snyad thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdags pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni tha snyad thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What is called transcending designation is explained as completely beyond all conventions.

original: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i las mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i las mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúperfectly transcending the three realms‚Äù is ‚Äúnot observing the karma of virtuous and nonvirtuous formations.‚Äù

original: las kyi sgra ni byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi sgra ni byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúkarma‚Äù refers to activity.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa des las gang byed pa de ni skyed byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa des las gang byed pa de ni skyed byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Whatever virtuous and nonvirtuous formations there are, the karma that is created by them is called ‚Äúthat which is produced.‚Äù

original: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not observed.

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni lta ba po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
