analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni lta ba po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúnot seeing‚Äù is ‚Äúfree from a seer.‚Äù

original: byang chub las gud na lta ba po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub las gud na lta ba po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from awakening, there is no seer.

original: ma thos pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma thos pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúnot hearing‚Äù is ‚Äúperfectly transcending the domain of consciousness.‚Äù

original: bye brag ma phyed pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúnot discriminating‚Äù is ‚Äúnot observing the threeüîΩtimes.‚Äù

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said to be beyond the range of the mental consciousness.

original: gang yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba byang chub ces bya ba gzung bar bya ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: gang yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba byang chub ces bya ba gzung bar bya ba gang yang med de /
translated: There is no object of the mental consciousness that is called ‚Äúawakening‚Äù that could be apprehended.

original: spros pa thams @82b cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub po //
analyzed: spros pa thams @82b cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub po //
translated: Awakening is the wisdom that is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ga la yod /
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ga la yod /
translated: How could it have the nature of an object apprehended and an apprehending subject?

original: bag chags thams cad kyi gnas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa byang chub kyi gnas skabs na log pa'i phyir gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags thams cad kyi gnas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa byang chub kyi gnas skabs na log pa'i phyir gzhi med pa'o //
translated: Since the consciousness that is the ripening of all habitual tendencies is absent in the state of awakening, it is groundless.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rten med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rten med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúwithout support,‚Äù

original: 'khor ba'i sa bon rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sa bon rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the absence of a basis for the seeds of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i de'i bshad pa ni nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i de'i bshad pa ni nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation ‚Äúwithout an object‚Äù is ‚Äúlike space.‚Äù

original: dper na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa tsam gyis mtshan nyid nam mkha' la dmigs pa med pa ltar byang chub la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa tsam gyis mtshan nyid nam mkha' la dmigs pa med pa ltar byang chub la yang de bzhin te /
translated: For example, just as space is the mere absence of obstructive contact, and is not an object of perception, so also is enlightenment,

original: de la dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an object of perception.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gnyis las skyes pa'i rgyu ba dang / spros pa de dag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gnyis las skyes pa'i rgyu ba dang / spros pa de dag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the absence of that movement and conceptual elaboration which arise from the two habitual propensities for karmic results and natural evolution,

original: rgyu ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa ste /
translated: there is no movement and no conceptual elaboration.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is the order.

original: tshig de gnyis kyi bshad pa ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig de gnyis kyi bshad pa ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of these two terms is ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gnyis kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gnyis kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not conditioned by the two habitual propensities for karmic results and natural evolution.

original: 'dis rgol ba ngan pa 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis rgol ba ngan pa 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: This is ‚Äúentrance‚Äù because it causes the entrance of bad arguments.

original: skabs su gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su gyur pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: This is the fault of being open to rejoinders.

original: de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the absence of that,

original: 'jug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ste /
translated: there is no entrance.

original: de'i phyir de ni skabs med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni skabs med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as ‚Äúwithout entrance.‚Äù

original: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa zhes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa ste de'i las shin tu 'das so //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa zhes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa ste de'i las shin tu 'das so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlimited cognition‚Äù refers to the obscuration of the knowable that has not been eliminated.

original: de ni rtag tu med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o //üîΩdpag pa ni 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su bcad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa'o // dpag pa ni 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su bcad pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is always non-existent‚Äù is the explanation of that.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is not an object of conceptualization‚Äù means that it is not an object of conceptualization in the sense that it cannot be delimited as being of this or that measure.

original: de med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //üîΩde'i bshad pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o // de'i bshad pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is immeasurable.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is immeasurable‚Äù is the explanation of that.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni gzhan dag la bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni gzhan dag la bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not an object of demonstration‚Äù is the explanation of that.

original: de ni sngon po la sogs pa de bzhin du bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni sngon po la sogs pa de bzhin du bstan par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be demonstrated as being blue, etc.

original: sgra'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la sgra zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sgra'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la sgra zhes brjod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúsound‚Äù is used in the sense of conceptual thought because it is the cause of sound.

original: de med pa'i phyir sgra med pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir sgra med pa ste /
translated: Since it does not exist, it is soundless.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the reality that is known by non-dual intuition.

original: rang gis rig pa'i dngos po la ni rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i dngos po la ni rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: There is no conceptual thought in regard to the thing that is known by oneself.

original: de'i phyir so so rang gis rig pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir so so rang gis rig pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúto be realized by each one for himself. ‚Äù

original: yi ge med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Without letters‚Äù means

original: yi ge 'di dbang pos 'dzin cing len pa dang de las snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'di dbang pos 'dzin cing len pa dang de las snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that the letters are not apprehended by the sense faculties, nor do they appear from them.

original: de med pa ni yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa ni yi ge med pa ste /
translated: The absence of that is ‚Äúwithout letters. ‚Äù

original: de ni snang ba med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni snang ba med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúwithout appearance. ‚Äù

original: tshig gi lam ni spyi'i rnam par sgro btags pa ste /üîΩde @83a * //
analyzed: tshig gi lam ni spyi'i rnam par sgro btags pa ste / de @83a * //
translated: The ‚Äúpath of speech‚Äù is a verbal reification.üîΩThat

original: gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is not in it, therefore it is so called.

original: sgra med pa zhes bya ba des ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgra med pa zhes bya ba des ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: ‚Äú Without sound‚Äù shows that it is not an object of conceptualization.

original: 'dis ni ngag gi yul ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngag gi yul ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is not an object of speech.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i dbang gis gzung ba rnam par gzhag pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i dbang gis gzung ba rnam par gzhag pa ston te /
translated: All of this shows that the apprehended is established by the power of reifying conceptualization,

original: rnam pa de yang chos kyi dbyings la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de yang chos kyi dbyings la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that that conceptualization does not exist in the Reality limit.

original: de ltar re zhig byed pa po dang / byed pa dang las so sor brtags pa'i ngo bor med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byed pa po dang / byed pa dang las so sor brtags pa'i ngo bor med pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the agent, the action, and the object are shown to be nonexistent as entities that are separate.

original: de ni de ltar na su zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de ltar na su zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyir med pa bstan to //
translated: That is how it is. Who? etc. generally teaches non-existence.

original: su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni lus so //
analyzed: su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni lus so //
translated: Who is fully enlightened? The body.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byed par 'gyur ba ste sems so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byed par 'gyur ba ste sems so //
translated: By what? The agent, i.e. the mind.

original: gang yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub ces bya ba'o //
translated: What is it? Enlightenment.

original: gang gsungs pa de yang khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa de yang khong du chud ce na /
translated: And what is taught is also understood.

original: rnam pa'i reg pas de la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i reg pas de la rtog pa ste /
translated: By the touch of the aspect, one imagines it.

original: byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa 'dus pa rtogs pas khong du chud pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid rnam pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa 'dus pa rtogs pas khong du chud pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid rnam pa'o //
translated: The understanding is established by the imagination of the union of agent, object and action.

original: 'di dag ni byed pa po la sogs pas khong du chud pa'i dus na yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byed pa po la sogs pas khong du chud pa'i dus na yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: These are the causes of imagination when there is understanding of the agent, etc.

original: bdag nyid khong na brjod pa'i dus na ming tsam dag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid khong na brjod pa'i dus na ming tsam dag go //
translated: At the time of speaking, they are mere names.

original: bdag nyid kha ton byed pa la sogs pa'i dus na btags pa tsam dag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kha ton byed pa la sogs pa'i dus na btags pa tsam dag go //
translated: At the time of recitation, etc. they are mere designations.

original: gzhan dag khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brdar 'dogs pa'i dus na brda tsam dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brdar 'dogs pa'i dus na brda tsam dag go //
translated: In order to make others understand, when one is designating a convention, they are mere conventions.

original: gzhan dag la tha snyad btags pas brjod pa na tha snyad tsam dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la tha snyad btags pas brjod pa na tha snyad tsam dag ste /
translated: When one is expressing them to others by means of conventional designations, they are mere conventions.

original: 'di dag kyang da ni ji ltar khong du chud pa de yang ming dang / btags pa dang / brda dang / tha snyad tsam du zad pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bshad de /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang da ni ji ltar khong du chud pa de yang ming dang / btags pa dang / brda dang / tha snyad tsam du zad pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bshad de /
translated: And these also should be understood as having no reality of imagined identity, since they are exhausted as mere names, mere designations, mere conventions, and mere expressions, just as one understands them.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: tshig bzhi po 'di dag kyang brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig rnams kyis rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: tshig bzhi po 'di dag kyang brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig rnams kyis rab tu phye'o //
translated: The four terms are analyzed by the words of the scripture beginning with ‚Äúimagination.‚Äù

original: de'i bshad pa ni rnam pa drug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rnam pa drug gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is the passage beginning ‚ÄúIn six ways.‚Äù

original: brtags pa / yongs su brtags pa zhes bya ba yang don gcig ste /
analyzed: brtags pa / yongs su brtags pa zhes bya ba yang don gcig ste /
translated: Imagined and thoroughly imagined have the same meaning.

original: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúfalse imagination. ‚Äù

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub po //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ye shes nyid byang chub po //
translated: The very wisdom free from all conceptual elaborations is enlightenment.

original: de las gud na gzung ba yod par yongs su rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de las gud na gzung ba yod par yongs su rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The imagination of a separate object of apprehension apart from that is false imagination.

original: ye shes kyang khong du chud par bya ba las gud na byed pa'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyang khong du chud par bya ba las gud na byed pa'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because wisdom also does not exist as an agent apart from what is to be understood.

original: ma byung @83b pa byung ba med pa yang don gcig ste /
analyzed: ma byung @83b pa byung ba med pa yang don gcig ste /
translated: ‚Äú Non-arisen‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù have the same meaning.

original: de'i bshad pa ni gsog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni gsog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúempty. ‚Äù

original: khong du chud par byed pa po yang bdag la sogs pa byed pa po med pa'i phyir /üîΩrdzas ma yin pa /
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa po yang bdag la sogs pa byed pa po med pa'i phyir / rdzas ma yin pa /
translated: Because there is no agent such as a self,üîΩit is not a substance.

original: rdzas med pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas med pa ste /
translated: It is not a non-substance.

original: de yang don gcig go //
analyzed: de yang don gcig go //
translated: That also has the same meaning.

original: de'i bshad pa ni bdag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni bdag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of a self. ‚Äù

original: yongs su dag pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa nyid khong du chud par byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa nyid khong du chud par byed pa po yin no //
translated: The very non-dual pure wisdom is the one who understands.

original: de nyid khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be understood just as it is.

original: de la byed pa po la sogs pa tha dad par sgro 'dogs pas shes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa po la sogs pa tha dad par sgro 'dogs pas shes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul ba ste /
translated: That cognition which arises through the superimposition of a difference between the agent, etc. is erroneous.

original: shes pa des gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs blang bar mi nus pas len pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa des gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs blang bar mi nus pas len pa med pa'o //
translated: Since that cognition is unable to take up the state of nondual intuition, it is said to be without appropriation.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pa'i shes rab las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pa'i shes rab las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as transcending mundane wisdom.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni yi ge'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni yi ge'i lam las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the statement that it is ‚Äúunmanifest‚Äù is that it transcends the path of letters.

original: mngon par chags pa med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa med pa zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the statement that it is ‚Äúnon-attached‚Äù is that it is free from the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the grasping of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyid mngon par chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon par chags pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyid mngon par chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon par chags pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the grasping of ‚Äúmine‚Äù are considered to be the cause of attachment.

original: de ltar re zhig byed pa po dang / las dang / bya bar sgro btags pas byang chub khong du chud pa bkag pa la kha cig skur ba 'debs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byed pa po dang / las dang / bya bar sgro btags pas byang chub khong du chud pa bkag pa la kha cig skur ba 'debs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the above, the understanding of enlightenment is refuted by the superimposition of agent, action, and object of action.

original: de bas na de bsal ba'i phyir 'di la gang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de bsal ba'i phyir 'di la gang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove that, it is said here, ‚ÄúWhoever thinks thus‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa po dang / byed pa la sogs par sgro btags pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba mdo'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / byed pa la sogs par sgro btags pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba mdo'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that the non-dual wisdom free from the superimposition of agent, action, and so on, is called ‚Äúself-awareness.‚Äù

original: 'di ni su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of ‚ÄúWho will fully awaken?‚Äù and so on.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la sogs pa kun brtags pa de dag las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la sogs pa kun brtags pa de dag las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing things as they really are‚Äù means the non-dual wisdom free from the imagined agent and so on, which is called ‚Äúself-awareness.‚Äù

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i ye shes de nyid sgrib pa spangs pas thams cad nas shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba'i ye shes de nyid sgrib pa spangs pas thams cad nas shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: That very intuition which is free from the adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject is the complete understanding because it is the knowledge of everything through the abandonment of obscuration.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir mngon sum du byas pa'o //üîΩphyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir mngon sum du byas pa'o // phyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the realization because it is the intuition of the individual.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the immutable because it is free from erroneous inversion.

original: rang bzhin gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the unchanging because it is essentially free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de gnyis kyis rab tu dang ba dang / rab tu @84a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis rab tu dang ba dang / rab tu @84a * //
translated: These two are taught respectively as:

original: zhi bar zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du bstan te /
analyzed: zhi bar zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du bstan te /
translated: the purity and the peace.

original: phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / 'gyur ba med par yongs su gab par bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / 'gyur ba med par yongs su gab par bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The absence of erroneous inversion is taught as the complete accomplishment and the immutability.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skabs su mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skabs su mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the absence of characteristic is as before. The absence of the characteristic of the mind is taught as the absence of characteristic.

original: der mtshan nyid med pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der mtshan nyid med pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the word that is the expression of the meaning of a word that does not have a definition, and that is what is meant here by that.

original: mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba'o //
translated: The comprehension of reality, which is free from all clinging, is the function of meditative concentration.

original: khong du chud pa brjod pa kun rdzob tu spyi'i rnam pas nyan pa po'i rgyud la skyed pa ni bstan pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa brjod pa kun rdzob tu spyi'i rnam pas nyan pa po'i rgyud la skyed pa ni bstan pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of that comprehension, which is generated in the continuum of the listener through a general aspect on the conventional level, is the function of teaching.üîΩAlthough it is taught here that he rises up, this should be understood from the passage that comes later:

original: 'dir bzhengs par bstan du zin kyang 'di ni nang du yang dag bzhag nas chos kyi dbyings nyid la rtog ste zhes bya ba'i 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bzhengs par bstan du zin kyang 'di ni nang du yang dag bzhag nas chos kyi dbyings nyid la rtog ste zhes bya ba'i 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having settled into the inner, he contemplates the realm of phenomena itself.

original: 'di man chad du ni ting nge 'dzin myong ba'i don 'phags pa 'jam dpal las brtsams nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad du ni ting nge 'dzin myong ba'i don 'phags pa 'jam dpal las brtsams nas bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, the meaning of the experience of meditative concentration is taught beginning with noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.üîΩAs it says, How should I understand that enlightenment?

original: 'di ltar bdag gis byang chub de ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis byang chub de ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Up to:

original: byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Enlightenment is without defining characteristics.

original: 'di man chad ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa gtan la dbab pa las brtsams nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa gtan la dbab pa las brtsams nas bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, the teaching is based on the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´‚Äôs questions in the Ascertainment.

original: de bas na bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThus, the teaching is twofold‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan du na gal te byang chub ni 'gyur ba med pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te byang chub ni 'gyur ba med pa /
translated: Otherwise, if awakening were unchanging,

original: mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba /
translated: unmoving,

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de'i 'og tu bzhengs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba de'i 'og tu bzhengs par 'gyur na /
translated: and without characteristics, then after that, how could it be taught?

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal las brtsams te thog mar bstan par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal las brtsams te thog mar bstan par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be taught first, based on the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´?

original: ma bstan pa'i don la rje btsun 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i don la rje btsun 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the venerable noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ ask the Blessed One, ‚ÄúIf awakening has such characteristics, Blessed One‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on, if the meaning had not been taught?

original: gal te sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ji ltar mnyam par gzhag /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ji ltar mnyam par gzhag /
translated: If the buddhas are always in equipoise, how could they be in equipoise?

original: ji ltar bzhengs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzhengs she na /
translated: How could they rise?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / bzhengs pa bstan pa ni 'dul ba'i don du bstan pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa dang / bzhengs pa bstan pa ni 'dul ba'i don du bstan pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The teaching of meditative equipoise and rising is taught for the sake of disciplining, so there is no fault.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal kho na la bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal kho na la bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: Why did he speak only to the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´?

original: 'jam dpal byang chub de ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub de ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, what is that enlightenment like?

original: de nyid kyis zhus pa'i phyir de nyid la bka' stsal bar rigs par nges te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhus pa'i phyir de nyid la bka' stsal bar rigs par nges te /
translated: Since he himself asked, it is certain that it is appropriate for him to be addressed.

original: klan kar mi rung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: klan kar mi rung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it improper to criticize?

original: bka' stsal pas des kyang zhus par ni rig ste @84b nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bka' stsal pas des kyang zhus par ni rig ste @84b nyes pa med do //
translated: It is known that he asked, so there is no fault.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus she na zhes bya ba ni dri ba gnyis pa bzung ste gleng ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis zhus she na zhes bya ba ni dri ba gnyis pa bzung ste gleng ba'o //
translated: Why did the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ ask? This is the second question taken up and discussed.

original: de nyid la bka' stsal zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la bka' stsal zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, He himself was addressed, because he was addressed immediately after.

original: byang chub de ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yang byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub de ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yang byang chub ste /
translated: What is that enlightenment like? and so on, because it is free from all clinging, it is enlightenment.

original: mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral bas der 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral bas der 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should enter there, free from all clinging.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar rab tu 'tshal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar rab tu 'tshal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Bhagavat, how should one understand?

original: bstan pa na zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan pa na zhes bya ba khong nas 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning is: When it is taught.

original: bstan kyang mi shes na ji ltar thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug ces bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan kyang mi shes na ji ltar thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug ces bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one does not understand even when it is taught, then how can one enter the path of meditation through the stages of hearing, reflection, etc.?

original: 'jam dpal byang chub ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das par bstan to //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, enlightenment is transcendent to the three realms. By this, it is shown that it is utterly transcendent to conceptualization.

original: de bas na gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub so so rang gis rig pa bstan pa'i yul dug la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub so so rang gis rig pa bstan pa'i yul dug la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, enlightenment, which is the nature of the wisdom that is isolated from the duality of subject and object, is the domain of the knowledge of individual intuitive wisdom.

original: de bas na tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: Convention, etc.

original: tha snyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: tha snyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: It is transcendent to convention,

original: yi ge'i sgra skad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis po de la tshig dang po ni gong du bstan du med pa zhes gang smos pa de dang don gcig ste ;
analyzed: yi ge'i sgra skad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis po de la tshig dang po ni gong du bstan du med pa zhes gang smos pa de dang don gcig ste ;
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúutterly transcends the sounds and words of letters‚Äù and ‚Äúutterly transcends sounds‚Äù have the same meaning as the phrase ‚Äúcannot be shown‚Äù above.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ltar bstan pa'i tha snyad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ltar bstan pa'i tha snyad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it utterly transcends the conventions of showing, like blue and so on.

original: yi ge brjod pa'i sgras gsal bar byad pa ni yi ge'i sgra skad de /
analyzed: yi ge brjod pa'i sgras gsal bar byad pa ni yi ge'i sgra skad de /
translated: The sounds and words of letters are the sounds that express letters.

original: de las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: It utterly transcends those.

original: de yang tshig gi lam zhes gong du bshad pa'i tshig dang don mthun no //
analyzed: de yang tshig gi lam zhes gong du bshad pa'i tshig dang don mthun no //
translated: That also has the same meaning as the phrase ‚Äúpath of words‚Äù above.

original: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra med pa zhes gang bstan pa de dang don mthun no //
analyzed: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra med pa zhes gang bstan pa de dang don mthun no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúutterly transcends sounds‚Äù has the same meaning as the phrase ‚Äúwithout sound‚Äù above.

original: de bas na 'og nas khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa la sogs pa bzhi'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'og nas khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa la sogs pa bzhi'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Therefore it explains below that the meaning of the four phrases ‚Äúutterly transcends the three realms‚Äù and so on is the same as before.

original: tha snyad rab tu brtags te rnam par gzhag pa nyid 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu brtags te rnam par gzhag pa nyid 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the engagement that is established by thoroughly investigating conventions.

original: de med pa'i phyir 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no engagement.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub khong du chud pa'i dus nyid ni byang chub 'jug pa med snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub khong du chud pa'i dus nyid ni byang chub 'jug pa med snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that at the time of the realization of enlightenment, there is no engagement of enlightenment?

original: gdod ma nyid nas 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gdod ma nyid nas 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúFrom the very beginning, there is no engagement.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid ni dus thams cad du tha snyad las shin tu 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dus thams cad du tha snyad las shin tu 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a statement that emptiness is beyond all conventions at all times.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad @85a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad @85a * //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: du rab tu btags nas gang stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa de las shin tu 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: du rab tu btags nas gang stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa de las shin tu 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Having designated conventionally, it is a statement that it is beyond that which is established as emptiness.

original: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar stong pa nyid bshad pa de ltar de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar stong pa nyid bshad pa de ltar de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúIt is not like that, as emptiness is explained.

original: rang gi ngo bo las spyi'i rnam par sgro btags nas bshad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las spyi'i rnam par sgro btags nas bshad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is explained by superimposing a universal on its own nature.‚Äù

original: bstan pa 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: However, the teaching is not without result.

original: kun rdzob tu brjod pas de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu brjod pas de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught conventionally, in order to enter into reality.

original: de bas na thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom pa yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas na thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bsgom pa yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of hearing, reflection, etc. is not without result.

original: gzhan du gal te bshad pas de kho na mngon sum du 'gyur bar brjod na ni thos pa'i dus nyid na de kho na khong du chud pas de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te bshad pas de kho na mngon sum du 'gyur bar brjod na ni thos pa'i dus nyid na de kho na khong du chud pas de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If, on the other hand, it is said that reality is realized through teaching, then, since reality would be understood at the time of hearing, it would be pointless to engage in it in order to understand it.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi phyir 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one engages in it for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de ni zhus pa de yang 'jug pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni zhus pa de yang 'jug pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the passage beginning with ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should understand that engagement to be pure.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral bas byang chub la sbyor ba ni 'jug pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad dang bral bas byang chub la sbyor ba ni 'jug pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Pure engagement is the application to enlightenment, free from all clinging.

original: spros par byed pas spros pa ste /
analyzed: spros par byed pas spros pa ste /
translated: Elaboration is the elaboration of the elaborated.

original: byang chub ni khong du chud par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni khong du chud par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the essence of what is to be realized.

original: de bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to eliminate that.

original: de ni 'jug pa med pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba tshig 'di'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa med pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba tshig 'di'i bshad pa'o //
translated: That is the explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthe engagement that is non-engagement.‚Äù

original: rab tu brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa med pa ni 'jug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu brtags nas rnam par gzhag pa med pa ni 'jug pa med pa ste /
translated: The non-existence of a conceptualized establishment is non-engagement.

original: des 'jug pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: des 'jug pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement by that is the engagement in enlightenment.

original: sgom par byed /
analyzed: sgom par byed /
translated: One meditates.

original: byang chub 'dzin par byed pas dngos po ste 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'dzin par byed pas dngos po ste 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One holds to enlightenment.

original: de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the non-existence of that,

original: dngos po med pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: one engages in the non-existence of things.

original: tshig snga mas ni gzung ba dngos po med par bstan gyi /
analyzed: tshig snga mas ni gzung ba dngos po med par bstan gyi /
translated: The former phrase teaches the non-existence of the object,

original: 'dzin pa dngos po med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dngos po med par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the non-existence of the subject.

original: de ltar bye brag yod de /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag yod de /
translated: There is a distinction in that way.

original: de'i bshad pa ni chos su 'dzin pa bor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni chos su 'dzin pa bor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúthe elimination of the grasping of dharmas.‚Äù

original: chos su 'dzin pas chos su 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chos su 'dzin pas chos su 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The grasping of dharmas is the nature of the grasping of dharmas.

original: bla gab med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bla gab med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout a covering‚Äù is as before.

original: sems kyi skabs su dngos po med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi skabs su dngos po med pa /
translated: In the context of mind, it is ‚Äúunconditioned.üîΩ‚Äù In the context of the stage of the TathƒÅgata, it is ‚Äúuncovered.

original: bla gab med pa zhes der gang gsungs pa'i bla gab med pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dir yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes der gang gsungs pa'i bla gab med pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dir yang zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù The meaning of ‚Äúuncovered‚Äù there is the same as here.

original: der ring du song ba zhes pa ni byang chub de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo thams cad du song ba'i phyir ring du song ba nyid do //
analyzed: der ring du song ba zhes pa ni byang chub de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo thams cad du song ba'i phyir ring du song ba nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Gone far‚Äù there means ‚Äúgone far‚Äù because of going everywhere to the reality of enlightenment.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ste /
translated: The nature of the dharma-dhƒÅtu is peace by its intrinsic reality,

original: rang bzhin gyis @85b 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis @85b 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is naturally luminous.

original: de'i bshad pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúpeace.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni rtag pa nyid du 'am chad pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa ni rtag pa nyid du 'am chad pa nyid du ste /
translated: ‚Äù Attachment to all dharmas is as permanent or as annihilated.

original: de med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no attachment.

original: de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa por ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa por ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúthe abandonment of grasping permanence and impermanence.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs par gyur ba de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs par gyur ba de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: ‚Äù The limit of reality is the object of observation of that, so it is the limit of reality.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path is the objective support of thatness.

original: de'i dbyer med pa ni dor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbyer med pa ni dor ba med pa'o //
translated: The non-relinquishment of that is the non-relinquishment of the dependent.

original: de bas na lam la skur pa 'debs pa bor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na lam la skur pa 'debs pa bor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the relinquishment of the path is the relinquishment of the disparagement of the dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs par gyur pa de bor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa'o//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs par gyur pa de bor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa'o//
translated: The relinquishment of the objective support of the perfect is the disparagement of the dependent.

original: gzhag pa ni byis pas yongs su brtags te yod par sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa ni byis pas yongs su brtags te yod par sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The establishment is the superimposition of the existence of the imagined by the childish.

original: de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that does not exist,

original: dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa'o //
translated: there is the non-relinquishment and the non-establishment.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The non-difference is the selflessness of the person.

original: tha dad pa med pa ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The non-differentiation is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa la 'jug pa tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa la 'jug pa zhes re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa la 'jug pa tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa la 'jug pa zhes re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúengagement‚Äù is applied to each of the non-relinquishment and the non-establishment, as the engagement in the non-difference and the engagement in the non-differentiation.

original: dang po'i bshad pa ni skur pa dang sgro btags pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i bshad pa ni skur pa dang sgro btags pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first explanation is the avoidance of disparagement and superimposition.

original: gnyis pa'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the second is called ‚ÄúEntering into the One Way of All Dharmas.‚Äù

original: tshul gcig pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gcig pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: The one way is selflessness.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i mig yor la /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i mig yor la /
translated: The mirror of the analytical knowledges

original: mig yor ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mig yor ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mirror is the aspect of a deluded consciousness, such as a whirling firebrand.

original: dngos po rnams so so yang dag par rig pa'i mig yor la sogs pa 'di dag dang mtshungs par de ltar 'jug pa'o zhes mdo'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams so so yang dag par rig pa'i mig yor la sogs pa 'di dag dang mtshungs par de ltar 'jug pa'o zhes mdo'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sutra passage is that one should enter into all things as similar to these, the mirror of the analytical knowledges, etc.

original: de'i bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The commentary on that is called ‚ÄúThe Cultivation of the Perfection of Wisdom.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rnam par zhugs pa'i sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par zhugs pa'i sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the cultivation of the entry into suchness.

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi'i don rnam par dbye ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal byang chub ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi'i don rnam par dbye ba ni zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal byang chub ni khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: The meaning is as follows: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, enlightenment is transcendent to the three realms,

original: tha snyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: tha snyad las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: transcendent to conventions,

original: yi ge'i sgra las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: yi ge'i sgra las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: transcendent to the sounds of syllables,

original: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de dag gi don to //
analyzed: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba de dag gi don to //
translated: and transcendent to sounds.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'di sngar sbyar zin pas yang ma brjod do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'di sngar sbyar zin pas yang ma brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúAs before‚Äù means that since this has already been applied earlier, it is not stated again.

original: @86a * // de ltar gleng gzhi la sogs pa tshig gi don dgu'i nang nas gleng gzhi nas bzung ste bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du tshig bdun gyi don ni bshad zin to /
analyzed: @86a * // de ltar gleng gzhi la sogs pa tshig gi don dgu'i nang nas gleng gzhi nas bzung ste bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du tshig bdun gyi don ni bshad zin to /
translated: Thus, from among the nine topics of the introduction, up to the explanation of the seven topics beginning with the introduction has been explained.

original: // / da ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu ste /
analyzed: // / da ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu ste /
translated: Now, the power of the bodhisattva‚Äôs qualities is explained.

original: tshig gi don rgyas par bshad par 'dod nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gi don rgyas par bshad par 'dod nas de la byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi mthu ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The author wishes to explain the meaning of the words in detail. The power of the bodhisattva's virtues should be known by two aspects:

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa dang / spobs pa thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa dang / spobs pa thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: the fulfillment of the desired meaning and unobstructed eloquence.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa de yang gong nas gong du rnam pa bcu bzhis mngon par sgrub par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa de yang gong nas gong du rnam pa bcu bzhis mngon par sgrub par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fulfillment of the desired meaning should be known as accomplished by fourteen aspects, higher and higher.

original: bcu bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fourteen?

original: gdams ngag mi brjed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gdams ngag mi brjed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, not forgetting the instructions and so on.

original: de yang de nas lha'i bu zla ba dri ma med pa'i gzi brjid 'od zer gyi 'od ces bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i dum bu'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de nas lha'i bu zla ba dri ma med pa'i gzi brjid 'od zer gyi 'od ces bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i dum bu'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, from there, the explanation of the passage of the sutra beginning with the light of the radiance of the stainless splendor of the celestial son Candraprabha.

original: rtsom pa ni nang gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa ni nang gi rgyu ste /
translated: Commencement is the internal cause,

original: rtsa bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa bar gyur ba'o //
translated: it becomes the root.

original: gnas ni phyi'i ste dmigs par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ni phyi'i ste dmigs par gyur ba'o //
translated: Abiding is the external, it becomes the object.

original: de bas na rtsom pa ni snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtsom pa ni snying rje chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, commencement is great compassion.

original: gnas ni sems can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas ni sems can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The realm is sentient beings.

original: gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub ces bya ba ni snying rje la sogs pa snga ma snga mas g-yo med pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub ces bya ba ni snying rje la sogs pa snga ma snga mas g-yo med pa la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by the higher, etc. means that the former compassion, etc. accomplishes the latter non-deceptiveness, etc.

original: cis bsdus zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang gis bsdus pa'i snying rje chen po'i 'bras bu gang zhes dri ba'i don to //
analyzed: cis bsdus zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang gis bsdus pa'i snying rje chen po'i 'bras bu gang zhes dri ba'i don to //
translated: By what is it included? means by what result is the result of great compassion included?

original: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the lower ones as well.

original: g-yo med pas bsdus zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang ldan na g-yo med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo med pas bsdus zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang ldan na g-yo med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is included by non-deceptiveness means that if one possesses compassion, one becomes non-deceptive.

original: de'i bshad pa ni gdams ngag mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni gdams ngag mi brjed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called not forgetting the instructions.

original: gdams ngag ni yang dag pa'i man ngag go //
analyzed: gdams ngag ni yang dag pa'i man ngag go //
translated: The instructions are the true instructions.

original: g-yo med par sems can gyi don du yang dag pa'i gdams ngag 'dzin na de'i phyir mi brjed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo med par sems can gyi don du yang dag pa'i gdams ngag 'dzin na de'i phyir mi brjed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds the true instructions for the benefit of sentient beings without deception, then one becomes one who does not forget them.

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni g-yo med na sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni g-yo med na sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúthought of sameness toward all sentient beings‚Äù arises from the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings, if there is no deceit.

original: sems snyoms pa yang thams cad 'du byed du mnyam pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral bas 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems snyoms pa yang thams cad 'du byed du mnyam pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral bas 'dzin to //
translated: The thought of sameness is understood as being free of attachment and aversion, because all sentient beings are the same in being compounded.

original: de'i bshad pa ni legs par bzung ba'i gdams ngag 'dus byas la nye bar rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni legs par bzung ba'i gdams ngag 'dus byas la nye bar rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is the instruction of proper understanding of the compounded.

original: g-yo med pa'i stobs kyis gdams ngag legs par gzung ba 'dus byas la nye bar rtog ste /
analyzed: g-yo med pa'i stobs kyis gdams ngag legs par gzung ba 'dus byas la nye bar rtog ste /
translated: By the power of non-deceit, one properly grasps the instruction and understands the compounded.

original: sems can rnams la chos la bdag @86b med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mnyam par rtog cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos la bdag @86b med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mnyam par rtog cing /
translated: One understands the sameness of the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons with regard to sentient beings.

original: 'dus byas thams cad la chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mnyam par gzhag pa nyid du zhugs nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad la chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med par mnyam par gzhag pa nyid du zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into the meditative equipoise on the sameness of the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons with regard to all compounded things,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i yul ci rigs par mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i yul ci rigs par mi mthong ba ste /
translated: The object of the obscuration of the afflictions and the obscuration to that which is to be known is not seen in any way.

original: de bas na tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i spyod pa dang go rims bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i spyod pa dang go rims bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should see the practice as neither different nor not different, respectively.üîΩThus, although these things are empty of the two, the person and the phenomena, those who do not see reality are deceived by the aspects of the person and the phenomena.

original: de ltar dngos po 'di dag chos dang gang zag gnyis kyis stong yang de kho na ma mthong ba dag chos dang gang zag gi rnam pas bslus so zhes 'dus byas rnams la nyes par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po 'di dag chos dang gang zag gnyis kyis stong yang de kho na ma mthong ba dag chos dang gang zag gi rnam pas bslus so zhes 'dus byas rnams la nyes par lta ba yin te /
translated: This is the view of the faults of the conditioned.

original: de ni de la yang nyes par lta ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni de la yang nyes par lta ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: It is called the view of the faults of the conditioned.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la'o //
translated: The conditioned refers to the conditioned factors.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa de gnyis spangs pa'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa de gnyis spangs pa'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The practice as neither different nor not different is the intention to abandon the two obscurations, the obscuration of the afflictions and the obscuration to that which is to be known, and the superior intention, respectively.

original: de bas na nyes pa de dag dang mi bsten pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa de dag dang mi bsten pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that one should not rely on those faults.

original: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa ci'i phyir byung zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa gnyis ci zhig gi phyir byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa ci'i phyir byung zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa gnyis ci zhig gi phyir byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: for what reason do intention and superior intention arise?

original: tshig gong ma rnams la yang de bzhin du phyir zhes bya ba blta'o //
analyzed: tshig gong ma rnams la yang de bzhin du phyir zhes bya ba blta'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhy‚Äù should be supplied with the preceding words as well.üîΩThey arise for the sake of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'khrul pa rnams kyis sems can 'di dag shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i gnas su khrid de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa 'khrul pa rnams kyis sems can 'di dag shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i gnas su khrid de /
translated: The spirit of enlightenment is generated with the thought: ‚ÄúThese sentient beings are led to a state of extreme suffering by the errors of the afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: de bas na bdag gis bdag bzhin du gzhan dag kyang nyes pa thams cad spangs te byang chub thob par bya'o zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed do ;
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis bdag bzhin du gzhan dag kyang nyes pa thams cad spangs te byang chub thob par bya'o zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed do ;
translated: Therefore, just as I have done for myself, I will help others to abandon all faults and attain enlightenment.‚Äù

original: / de'i bshad pa ni dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de'i bshad pa ni dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is the correct practice of virtue.

original: 'dis dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pas dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pa ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: 'dis dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pas dge ba'i las yang dag par 'dzin pa ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: It is the right grasp of good karma, because it rightly grasps good karma, i.e. the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi don du byung ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir byung ba'o zhes bsdu bar blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi don du byung ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi phyir byung ba'o zhes bsdu bar blta'o //
translated: The meaning of arisen for the sake of the thought of awakening is arisen for the sake of the thought of awakening, as should be understood from the summary.

original: 'og ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the following.üîΩThe meaning of arisen for the sake of the six perfections is arisen for the sake of the six perfections, as should be understood from the summary.üîΩThe meaning of arisen for the sake of the thought of awakening is arisen for the sake of the thought of awakening, as should be understood from the summary.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'jug go //
translated: The meaning of arisen for the sake of the six perfections is arisen for the sake of the six perfections, as should be understood from the summary.

original: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub kyi sems kyi 'bras bu'o //üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa'i bdag @87a * //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub kyi sems kyi 'bras bu'o // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa'i bdag @87a * //
translated: The six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.

original: nyid pha rol tu phyin pa ste /üîΩde bas na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyid pha rol tu phyin pa ste /üîΩde bas na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.üîΩThe six perfections are the result of the thought of awakening.

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'jug pa na thabs dang shes rab la 'jug ste /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'jug pa na thabs dang shes rab la 'jug ste /
translated: Because of both method and wisdom, when one enters into the six perfections, one enters into method and wisdom.

original: de la thabs kyis ni 'khor ba mi gtong la /
analyzed: de la thabs kyis ni 'khor ba mi gtong la /
translated: By means of method, one does not abandon samsara.

original: shes rab kyis ni de'i nyes pa rnams kyis mi gos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni de'i nyes pa rnams kyis mi gos te /
translated: By means of wisdom, one is not defiled by its faults.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
translated: Because of the non-defilement of both wisdom and method, one acts for the sake of sentient beings for as long as samsara lasts. Therefore, the morality of acting for the sake of sentient beings is pure.

original: de bas na tshul khrims yongs su dag ces bshad de //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims yongs su dag ces bshad de //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the purity of morality.

original: bag yod pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs dang ldan pa ni thams cad du bag yod par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yod pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thabs dang ldan pa ni thams cad du bag yod par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of heedfulness, it arises. Heedfulness is the state of being heedful in all situations, endowed with wisdom and method.

original: bag yod par gnas pa yang spyod lam thams cad du sems can rnams kyi dang ba bskyed pas sems can gyi don dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: bag yod par gnas pa yang spyod lam thams cad du sems can rnams kyi dang ba bskyed pas sems can gyi don dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: The state of being heedful is in accord with the welfare of sentient beings, because it generates faith in sentient beings in all situations.

original: de bas na sems can gyi don dang mthun pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi don dang mthun pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be in harmony with the aims of sentient beings.

original: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bag yod pa la gnas pa dag lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid sgrub bo //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bag yod pa la gnas pa dag lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid sgrub bo //
translated: It is the source of the three kinds of good conduct, because the one who is established in heedfulness accomplishes the morality that consists of the three kinds of good conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: de bas na legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni bag yod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni bag yod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the three kinds of good conduct are the result of heedfulness.

original: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When one possesses the three kinds of good conduct, the stores are perfected.

original: de bas na tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the stores are perfected.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid la brtson pa ni de dang mi mthun pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dag la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid la brtson pa ni de dang mi mthun pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag la mi 'jug go //
translated: It is the source of the ten wholesome courses of action, because the one who is intent on the morality that consists of the three kinds of good conduct of body, speech, and mind does not engage in their opposites, such as killing, etc.

original: de'i phyir de srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid sgrub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid sgrub bo //
translated: Therefore, he establishes the morality of restraint, such as the avoidance of killing.

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The ten paths of virtuous action, which are the essence of the morality of restraint, are the result of the three types of good conduct, which are the essence of the morality of engagement.

original: de ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims tha dad du phye ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims tha dad du phye ste /
translated: Thus, the morality of engagement and the morality of restraint are distinguished.

original: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos por bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos por bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the three types of good conduct and the ten paths of virtuous action are taught as the actual cause and result.

original: gzhan du na legs @87b par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams tha dad pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na legs @87b par spyod pa rnam pa gsum dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams tha dad pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, what would be the difference between the three types of good conduct and the ten paths of virtuous action?

original: srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la bsam pa brtan pa dag sems can log par zhugs pa rnams kyis mi skyo bas de ni yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la bsam pa brtan pa dag sems can log par zhugs pa rnams kyis mi skyo bas de ni yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: The steadfast intention to avoid taking life and so on is not discouraged by the waywardness of sentient beings. Therefore, it is called ‚Äúnot discouraged.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa 'dis sdom pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa 'dis sdom pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
translated: This teaching on the morality of engagement and disengagement teaches the morality of restraint.

original: sdom pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yang dag pa /
analyzed: sdom pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yang dag pa /
translated: It arises from restraint, because it is the perfect,

original: rab / gtso bo //
analyzed: rab / gtso bo //
translated: excellent,üîΩand principal result of restraint.

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'di las byung bas sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'di las byung bas sdom pa'o //
translated: It is restraint because buddhahood arises from it.

original: thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bdag med pa gnyi ga la brten pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la rab tu sbyor te /
analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bdag med pa gnyi ga la brten pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la rab tu sbyor te /
translated: It is the application to the factors of enlightenment that is based on both kinds of selflessness, through the stages of hearing and reflection.

original: de'i don du byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i don du byung ngo //
translated: It arises for that purpose.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi sdom pa la gnas pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir 'dis ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi sdom pa la gnas pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir 'dis ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims bstan to //
translated: One who abides in the vow of the path of the ten virtues enters into the factors of enlightenment through the stages of hearing, reflection, etc. Thus, this shows the morality of gathering virtuous factors.

original: gong du bshad ma thag pa byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam rnam par dag pas ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa sangs rgyas nyid 'grub bo //
analyzed: gong du bshad ma thag pa byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam rnam par dag pas ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa sangs rgyas nyid 'grub bo //
translated: The pure result, buddhahood, is accomplished by the pure path, which is the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment as just explained.

original: de bas na las kyi 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na las kyi 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the pure result of action.

original: tshul bzhin yid la bya ba'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan na rtag tu bdag med pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i yid la bya ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la bya ba'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan na rtag tu bdag med pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i yid la bya ba la 'jug ste /
translated: It arises from proper mental attention means that when one possesses the morality of gathering virtuous factors, one always engages in mental attention based on both kinds of selflessness.

original: de nyid 'dir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: That itself is proper mental attention here.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i bdag nyid des byang chub kyi phyogs la sbyor ba de rnam par dag go //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i bdag nyid des byang chub kyi phyogs la sbyor ba de rnam par dag go //
translated: The one who is established in the perfection of wisdom, by means of proper mental attention, has purified the application to the factors of enlightenment.

original: de bas na sbyor ba rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the application is purified.

original: so sor rtog pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can so so la skal ba ji ltar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can so so la skal ba ji ltar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: It arises from discernment, because one discerns the practice of the perfections according to the individual fortune of each sentient being.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni srid pa sgyu ma lta bur mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas ni srid pa sgyu ma lta bur mthong ngo //
translated: By means of proper mental attention, one sees existence as illusory.

original: de bas na 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don la shin tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don la shin tu 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, one engages in the welfare of sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de lta bas na sems can gyi don rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can gyi don rnam par dag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that the welfare of sentient beings is purified.

original: dran pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba la brtson par bya ba dang / mi bya ba dag la rtag tu dran pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba la brtson par bya ba dang / mi bya ba dag la rtag tu dran pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from mindfulness, because mindfulness always engages in what should and should not be done in striving to accomplish the welfare of all sentient beings.
