translated: The practice of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas is the practice of what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted, just as it is.

original: de yang shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa'o //
translated: And that is the explanation of the statement: ‚ÄúWisdom is the knowledge of discernment.‚Äù

original: yongs su gcod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the discrimination of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: shes rab ni chos thams cad la mi lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid dngos po brgyad kyi chos thams cad la mi lta ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos thams cad la mi lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid dngos po brgyad kyi chos thams cad la mi lta ba ste /
translated: This means that it is not seeing any phenomena that are the eight entities of the other-dependent nature.

original: sems can zhes bya ba de lta bur lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba de lta bur lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such view of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni chos zhes bya ba tsam nyid du bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni chos zhes bya ba tsam nyid du bzung ngo //
translated: They are apprehended as mere phenomena.

original: sems can du lta ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: sems can du lta ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The view of sentient beings is the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rkyen to //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nyes pa thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rkyen to //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the condition for samsara because it is the basis of all faults.

original: de'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad la rkyen gyis mi lta bar sngon du gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni chos thams cad la rkyen gyis mi lta bar sngon du gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called ‚Äúthe prior state of not seeing any phenomena as conditions.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen sems can du lta bas sems can thams cad la lta ba med pa de dag rkyen gyis mi lta ba dag go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen sems can du lta bas sems can thams cad la lta ba med pa de dag rkyen gyis mi lta ba dag go //
translated: Those who do not see any sentient beings due to the condition of the view of sentient beings are those who do not see any phenomena as conditions.

original: chos de thams cad de ltar bzung ba'i chos thams cad la rkyen gyis mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: chos de thams cad de ltar bzung ba'i chos thams cad la rkyen gyis mi lta ba'o //
translated: All those dharmas are not seen by the conditions of all those dharmas that are thus grasped.

original: de dag gi sngon du gtong ba ni chos tsam du bzung nas sems can thams cad sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: de dag gi sngon du gtong ba ni chos tsam du bzung nas sems can thams cad sngon du btang ste /
translated: The preliminary is that, having grasped them as mere dharmas, one should put all sentient beings first.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'o zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'o zhes bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary meaning is that one should enter into omniscience.

original: shes rab ni bral bas shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni bral bas shes pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is knowledge through separation.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni chags pa thams cad las grol ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni chags pa thams cad las grol ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúliberation from all attachments. ‚Äù

original: shes rab ni rgyu zad par 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu zad par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab ni rgyu zad par 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu zad par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Wisdom is the going to the exhaustion of causes, because it goes to the exhaustion of the causes of rebirth.

original: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba gcod pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba gcod pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by ‚Äúthe cutting off of rebirth. ‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is suchness.

original: de gcig pa nyid du thams cad du shes pa ni dbyer med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid du thams cad du shes pa ni dbyer med pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of its oneness everywhere is the knowledge of its indivisibility.

original: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is ‚Äúseeing things as they really are. ‚Äù

original: rnam par rig pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams te /
translated: The characteristic of the purity of consciousness is the Buddha-fields,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta bur snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from the cause of the consciousness that appears as the Buddha-fields.

original: de dag gi mnyam pa nyid ni gnyis las dben pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mnyam pa nyid ni gnyis las dben pa'o //
translated: Their sameness is the absence of duality.

original: de dbyer med par shes pa ni gcig tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dbyer med par shes pa ni gcig tu shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of their inseparability is the knowledge of their oneness.

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes @94b pa'i rab tu dbye ba'ang 'di nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes @94b pa'i rab tu dbye ba'ang 'di nyid de /
translated: This is also the classification of the knowledge of the inseparability of the Dharma-element.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi tshul gyis logs shig tu bshad par zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi tshul gyis logs shig tu bshad par zad do //
translated: It is merely explained separately by way of the Buddha-fields.

original: de'i bshad pa ni tshul gcig tu yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni tshul gcig tu yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Its explanation is called ‚Äúthe right orientation to the one principle.‚Äù

original: tshul gcig ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshul gcig ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The one principle is emptiness.

original: de yang dag par gzhol ba ni rnam par gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par gzhol ba ni rnam par gzhol ba'o //
translated: The right orientation to that is the orientation.

original: sems can dmigs su med pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: The non-apprehension of sentient beings is in terms of the imagined nature.

original: de'i bshad pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚Äúthe thorough examination of the imagined reality of the childish just as it is.‚Äù

original: byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa ni byis pas kun tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa ni byis pas kun tu brtags pa ste /
translated: The imagined reality of the childish is the imagined reality of the childish.

original: sems can no zhes de ltar sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can no zhes de ltar sgro btags pa'o //
translated: It is the superimposition of sentient beings in that way.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na ngo bor de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na ngo bor de mi dmigs so //
translated: When thoroughly examined just as it is, it is not perceived as a nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad gang las byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad gang las byung ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
translated: The source of all the qualities of the buddhas is all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the dharmadhƒÅtu free from all obscurations.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa shes pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the complete realization of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: de'i bshad pa ni zhi ba'i dbyings mngon sum du byed pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni zhi ba'i dbyings mngon sum du byed pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚Äúby actualizing the sphere of peace.‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid zhi ba'i dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid zhi ba'i dbyings so //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu itself is the sphere of peace.

original: lha'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nang nas tshogs kyi lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag go zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thug pa dag ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nang nas tshogs kyi lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag go zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la thug pa dag ste /
translated: Moreover, O Devaputra, the path of equipment is the five perfections, i.e. from generosity to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di dag gis dge ba sna tshogs sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis dge ba sna tshogs sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the accumulation of various virtues.

original: de'i bshad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs sgrub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs sgrub pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is the accomplishment of various roots of virtue.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa gcig bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa gcig bstan to //
translated: This indicates one aspect.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i lam ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i lam ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path of preparation is the perfection of wisdom, because of the thorough understanding of things just as they are.

original: de'i bshad pa ni yongs su gcod pa ste de'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni yongs su gcod pa ste de'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is thorough understanding, and its meaning is as before.

original: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba der yongs su gcod pa'i don gang yin pa 'dir yang de yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba der yongs su gcod pa'i don gang yin pa 'dir yang de yin te /
translated: Wisdom is thorough understanding. The meaning of thorough understanding there is the same here.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the second kind.

original: yang gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid rnam par ston to //
analyzed: yang gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid rnam par ston to //
translated: The next two kinds are shown by the next verse.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa'i lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa'i lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five perfections are the path of attachment.

original: de dag ni longs spyod chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pas 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni longs spyod chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pas 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the cause of cyclic existence because they are the results of great enjoyments, etc.

original: de bas na khams gsum na spyod pa zhes bshad do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' @95a * //
analyzed: de bas na khams gsum na spyod pa zhes bshad do // byang chub sems dpa' @95a * //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be practiced in the three realms.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the path of no attachment.

original: rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis zin pa dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin du zin kyang longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu sogs pas de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis zin pa dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin du zin kyang longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bu sogs pas de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Even though the giving, etc. of the bodhisattvas, when embraced by the distinctive transformation into universal enlightenment, are the cause of omniscience, they are called the path of attachment because they result in great enjoyments, etc.

original: chags pa med pa'i lam ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i lam ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the path of no attachment because it causes one to leave the three realms.

original: 'dis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //üîΩmtshan ma'i gnas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas te des shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do // mtshan ma'i gnas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas te des shes bya'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: This explains the passage, ‚ÄúThe contaminated path is a path that is limited by the extremes of the two confines.‚ÄùüîΩThe extreme of the sign is the extreme of the adherence to subject and object.üîΩThe path that is limited by that is the path that is limited by the extreme of the sign.

original: tshad yod par byas pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: tshad yod par byas pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is a path that has not abandoned the obscurations to omniscience,

original: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa yul yin pas mtha' dmigs pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa yul yin pas mtha' dmigs pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: It is explained that it is a path that is limited by the extreme of the apprehension of objects.

original: gnyis pa la gnas pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gnas pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is based on the second extreme is consciousness.

original: de'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of that consciousness.

original: rang gis rig pa'i tshul gyis yul du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gis rig pa'i tshul gyis yul du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is an object that is known by way of reflexive awareness.

original: gnyis pa mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis pa mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the second extreme, the extreme of the adherence of consciousness.

original: de bas na shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa med pas mtha' dmigs pa'i phyir de ni tshad yod par byas pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa med pas mtha' dmigs pa'i phyir de ni tshad yod par byas pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it does not engage all objects of knowledge, it is said to be limited because its end is perceived.

original: bzlog pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i gnas te /
translated: The opposite of that is the stage of signlessness,

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pas mtha' mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pas mtha' mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: which is explained as ‚Äúthe non-perception of an end‚Äù because it transcends the domain of consciousness.

original: gnyis pa mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo las 'das pa'i phyir shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pas mtha' mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis pa mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo las 'das pa'i phyir shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pas mtha' mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The second is explained as ‚Äúthe non-perception of an end‚Äù because it pervades all objects of knowledge by transcending the nature of consciousness that clings to duality.

original: de la shes pa'i lam ni sa dang po nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i lam ni sa dang po nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding that, the path of consciousness is from the first stage up to the seventh stage, because it is the nature of consciousness that engages with effort.

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúthe thorough knowledge of the realm of conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The conditioned is the cognition that is accompanied by formative influence.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dbyings so ;
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dbyings so ;
translated: That itself is the realm of the attributes of the Buddhas.

original: / de yongs su shes pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de yongs su shes pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The full understanding of that is the direct realization.üîΩThe path of elimination is from the eighth stage onwards.

original: spong ba'i lam ni sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yongs su shes pas de nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ni sa brgyad pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yongs su shes pas de nyid du bshad de /
translated: It is explained as being that itself because the realm of the unconditioned is fully understood through the direct realization of the realm of the unconditioned which is characterized by the abandonment of formative influence.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba lhun @95b gyis grub par 'jug pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba lhun @95b gyis grub par 'jug pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The unconditioned is the direct intuition that is free from formative influence and functions spontaneously.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dbyings so //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dbyings so //
translated: That itself is the realm because it is the cause of the attributes of the Buddha.

original: de yongs su shes pa ni so so rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa ni so so rang rig pa'o //
translated: The full understanding of that is the personal realization.üîΩHow is it revealed through its meaning?

original: ji ltar na don gyis rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na don gyis rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
translated: This is a question concerning the demonstration of the reality limit.

original: ji ltar na ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha' de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it distinguished by intuition? This is stated in order to show the means of comprehending the reality limit.

original: don ni 'dir de bzhin nyid la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni 'dir de bzhin nyid la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning here is the intention concerning thusness.

original: don gyis rab tu phye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis rab tu phye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it distinguished by meaning?

original: stong pa nyid las nges par skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las nges par skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is stated that it is born from emptiness.

original: ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it distinguished by intuition?

original: ye shes kyi stobs kyis sgrib pa spangs bar gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs kyis sgrib pa spangs bar gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is stated that it is the abandonment of obscuration by the power of intuition.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis don dang ye shes kyi dbye ba gsungs pa dang / ldan pa med pa dang / ldan pa ni go rims bzhin du 'og tu rab tu dbye ba nyid thabs sla bas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis don dang ye shes kyi dbye ba gsungs pa dang / ldan pa med pa dang / ldan pa ni go rims bzhin du 'og tu rab tu dbye ba nyid thabs sla bas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The distinction of meaning and intuition is stated by the noble Manjusri, and the absence of possession and possession should be explained later in order, since they are easily understood.

original: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thusness is twofold:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang / gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of the mere absence of subject and object, and it is the nature of the intuition which is isolated from duality.

original: de la dang pos bsdus pa 'di ni don dang ye shes kyi rnam par dbye bar blta ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang pos bsdus pa 'di ni don dang ye shes kyi rnam par dbye bar blta ba'o //
translated: Of these, the first is included in the objective aspect and the intuitive aspect.

original: 'di la gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: The second is only the nature of intuition.

original: de la don ldan pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la don ldan pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the non-existence of the objective aspect,

original: rigs kyi bu don ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu don ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, the objective is called uncompounded, etc.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'du bya ba med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'du bya ba med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is uncompounded because it is not compounded by causes and conditions.

original: de bas na gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is neither associated with nor dissociated from anything,

original: de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a thing.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir don ni ldan pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir don ni ldan pa med par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is not subject to impermanence, the objective is said to be non-associated.

original: de'i bshad pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi nyes pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called ‚Äúthe abandonment of the fault of impermanence.‚Äù

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na blo la gnyis shin tu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na blo la gnyis shin tu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The characteristic of immutability is because the mind is completely devoid of duality in the states of samsara and nirvana.

original: de med pa ni 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The absence of that is the characteristic of immutability.

original: gal te 'khor ba'i dus na gnyis dang ldan na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba'i dus na gnyis dang ldan na /
translated: If the mind were associated with duality in the state of samsara,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na mi ldan na ni de'i tshe 'gyur ba yin na de yang med de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na mi ldan na ni de'i tshe 'gyur ba yin na de yang med de /
translated: and not associated with it in the state of nirvana, then it would change at that time.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces brjod pa'i don de ni 'khor ba'i dus na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang dang yang ldan pa ma yin /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa @96a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces brjod pa'i don de ni 'khor ba'i dus na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang dang yang ldan pa ma yin / mya ngan las 'das pa @96a * //
translated: But that is not so, because the meaning that is called ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is not associated with any subject or object in the state of samsara,

original: na yang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: na yang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: and is not not associated with it in the state of nirvana.

original: de ni rtag tu gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu gnyis dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is because its nature is always free from duality.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya bas bshad do /üîΩgnyis dang bral ba tsam du rtag par gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya bas bshad do / gnyis dang bral ba tsam du rtag par gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúenduring by way of its own characteristic‚Äù because it is the mode of being of the object.

original: 'di ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin gyi /üîΩde'i rang gi mtshan nyid dngos po ltar don bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin gyi / de'i rang gi mtshan nyid dngos po ltar don bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.

original: sngar ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ldan pa med pas ldan pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ldan pa med pas ldan pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: It is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.

original: da ni gnyis dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di thams cad kyis ni stong pa nyid mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa bstan to //üîΩdon ni gdod ma nas yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pas grub pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gnyis dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'di thams cad kyis ni stong pa nyid mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa bstan to // don ni gdod ma nas yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pas grub pa ste /
translated: It is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.

original: phyin ci log tu sgro btags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sgro btags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.

original: de med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the mode of being of the object because it is the mode of being of the object.üîΩIt is the mode

original: gdod ma nas yongs su ma grub pa ni gdod ma nas yongs su grub pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gdod ma nas yongs su ma grub pa ni gdod ma nas yongs su grub pa med pa ste /
translated: That which is not ultimately established is not ultimately non-established.

original: rtag tu phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is always non-erroneously established.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is like space, because it is pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dang yang ldan pa'am mi ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is neither associated nor non-associated with anything.

original: sngar nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'am phyis mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'am phyis mi ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not that it is associated with the afflictions at first and later is not associated.

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: This shows that it is not associated because it is not associated with the afflictions.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub par yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub par yang bstan to //
translated: This also shows that emptiness is non-erroneously established because it is not naturally afflicted.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rtag tu chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rtag tu chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is that it always abides as the nature of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis sngon nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis sngon nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the Reality limit is that it is not originally defiled by addictions.

original: skur pa ni dor ba'o //
analyzed: skur pa ni dor ba'o //
translated: Denigration is discarding.

original: sgro btags pa ni gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa ni gzhag pa'o //
translated: Exaggeration is positing.

original: de dag med pa dang gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de skur pa dang / sgro btags pa'i mtha' spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang gi phyir kun brtags pa dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag med pa dang gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de skur pa dang / sgro btags pa'i mtha' spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang gi phyir kun brtags pa dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The characteristic of the absence of both is the avoidance of the extremes of denigration and exaggeration, which is to say, the avoidance of the extremes of discarding and positing.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa mi 'debs pas skur pa'i mtha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa mi 'debs pas skur pa'i mtha' ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the imagined reality is emptiness, which is the non-existence of that, the dependent reality is not. Therefore, since the dependent reality is not discarded, it is not the extreme of denigration.

original: kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i mtha' ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa med pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i mtha' ma yin no //
translated: Since the imagined reality does not exist, it is not the extreme of exaggeration.

original: de'i bshad pa @96b ni dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa @96b ni dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of that is the meaning of non-discarding and non-positing is as before, as above.

original: dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa la 'jug pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa der dor ba dang gzhag pa med pa'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dor ba med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa med pa la 'jug pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa der dor ba dang gzhag pa med pa'i sgra'i don gang yin pa de 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúnon-relinquishment‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-placement‚Äù here is the same as in the above passage.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don rang bzhin thams cad dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don rang bzhin thams cad dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: All of this shows that the meaning of emptiness, which has the characteristics as they have been explained, is the absence of all intrinsic natures.

original: de bas na byang chub sems pas stong pa nyid kyi don de de ltar bsgom mo //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems pas stong pa nyid kyi don de de ltar bsgom mo //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should cultivate the meaning of emptiness in that way.

original: des na byang chub sems dpas don gyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpas don gyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is said to be ‚Äúdistinguished by the meaning.‚Äù

original: 'di ni don gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩye shes ni ldan pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni don gyis bstan pa yin no // ye shes ni ldan pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the teaching by means of the meaning.üîΩThe teaching by means of the knowledge is as follows.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge is the path, etc.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i mtha' khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i mtha' khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs rgya cher bstan to //
translated: This extensively teaches the means of comprehending the perfect end.

original: de'i bshad pa ni de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The explanation of that is the means of comprehending that, etc.

original: / de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i tshig gsum zhes bya ba ni de dag gis don ston pas tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: / de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i tshig gsum zhes bya ba ni de dag gis don ston pas tshig ces bya ste /
translated: The three terms just mentioned are called terms because they show the meaning.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig gcig go //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig gcig go //
translated: The one term is the path is called wisdom, etc.

original: ye shes ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is wisdom is associated with abandonment, etc.

original: ye shes zhes pa ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is wisdom is the aggregate of wisdom, etc.

original: bcu pa phrag drug ces bya ba ni rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ye shes rnam pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu pa phrag drug go //
analyzed: bcu pa phrag drug ces bya ba ni rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ye shes rnam pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu pa phrag drug go //
translated: The six groups of ten are the ten kinds of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas, son of a good family, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'di snyed cig gis ye shes bstan snyam pa la gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di snyed cig gis ye shes bstan snyam pa la gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: Why are these many taught to be wisdom?

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi po de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa de dag ni de snyed kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhi po de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa de dag ni de snyed kyis bsdus so //
translated: The four beginning with ‚Äúby which‚Äù are the means of comprehending that wisdom.

original: ye shes de ni gcig pu yin na de ji snyed cig gis bsdus snyam pa la /
analyzed: ye shes de ni gcig pu yin na de ji snyed cig gis bsdus snyam pa la /
translated: That wisdom is singular, but why is it included in so many?

original: de la ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response, it is said that ‚Äúthat wisdom is together with its retinue.‚Äù

original: ye shes ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is uncontaminated.

original: 'khor ni rtsom pa dang sbyor pa 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni rtsom pa dang sbyor pa 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The retinue is the composition and application that will be explained below.

original: rnam pa gsum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni de la de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i tshig gsum dang / bcu pa dang pos ni ye shes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni de la de ma thag tu gsungs pa'i tshig gsum dang / bcu pa dang pos ni ye shes bstan to //
translated: The thirty-three aspects are the three terms just mentioned, and the first of the ten.

original: de'i 'khor du gyur pa rtsom pa dang sbyor ba ni @97a * //
analyzed: de'i 'khor du gyur pa rtsom pa dang sbyor ba ni @97a * //
translated: The composition and application that are its retinue are

original: go rims bzhin du bcu pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bcu pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa ste /
translated: The first, second, and third are the tenth, second, and third.üîΩ

original: rnam pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The tenth, second, and third verses respectively show the three aspects of the gnosis that is accompanied by its retinue.

original: bcu pa bzhi pas ni ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa bzhi pas ni ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The fourth verse of the tenth chapter shows how one should understand it.

original: lnga pas ni gang gi don khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pas ni gang gi don khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The fifth shows what one should understand.

original: drug pas ni gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: drug pas ni gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: The sixth shows where one should understand it.

original: de yang go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan te de ni 'og nas sbyor ro //
analyzed: de yang go rims bzhin du yongs su bstan te de ni 'og nas sbyor ro //
translated: That is taught in order, and will be applied below.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bas rab tu dga' bas bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam ste /üîΩde ni sems dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bas rab tu dga' bas bsdus pa mthong ba'i lam ste / de ni sems dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Gnosis is called the path, and is included in the path of seeing, which is included in the Joyful stage.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is associated with the mind, which is the fundamental consciousness.

original: mos pas spyod pa na mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsgos pa de dang ldan pa ste bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa na mngon par 'du byed pas yongs su bsgos pa de dang ldan pa ste bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is imbued with the imprints of the stage of action in faith, and is endowed with it, that is, it is generated.

original: de ni sems rnam par dag pas lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni sems rnam par dag pas lam rnam par dag pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as the pure path due to the pure mind.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mind is the fundamental consciousness.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa na bsod nams dang ye shes mngon bar 'du byed pa'i bag chags bsgos pa nyid mthong ba'i lam ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gdags pas rgyu rgyur pa rnam par dag pas lam rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa na bsod nams dang ye shes mngon bar 'du byed pa'i bag chags bsgos pa nyid mthong ba'i lam ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gdags pas rgyu rgyur pa rnam par dag pas lam rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: On the stage of action through devoted interest, the cause of the pure path is the cause of the pure path due to the purity of the cause of the cause, since the path of seeing is the cause of the impregnation of the instinct for the formative influence of merit and knowledge.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa 'byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa 'byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The path of seeing is the pure path, since it is the cause of the purity of the path.

original: mdo sde'i tshig 'di nyid kyi don gnyis bsdu na sems dang yang dag par ldan pa ni gang gis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: mdo sde'i tshig 'di nyid kyi don gnyis bsdu na sems dang yang dag par ldan pa ni gang gis bskyed pa ste /
translated: The meaning of this very statement of the S≈´tra is summarized in two ways: the mind is the cause of the generation of the path of seeing.

original: de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the pure path because it is the cause of the purity of the path of cultivation.üîΩThe path of cultivation is the path of cultivation due to the purity of the path of cultivation.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam skyes pas kun gzhi la spang bar bya ba'i sa bon gnas pa de spangs nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam skyes pas kun gzhi la spang bar bya ba'i sa bon gnas pa de spangs nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, when the path of seeing has arisen, the seeds to be abandoned that reside in the foundation consciousness are abandoned and the foundation consciousness itself arises in a superior way.

original: de ni lam rnam par dag pas sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni lam rnam par dag pas sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the purity of mind due to the purity of the path.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The formative forces subsumed by the level of action in faith are erroneous because they are associated with aspects.

original: de ji ltar ma 'khrul pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma 'khrul pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu yin snyam pa la /
translated: How can they be the cause of the non-erroneous path of seeing?

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ni lam dang ye shes kyi dmigs pa nyid gcig pu ste gnas yin zhing gcig la gcig brten pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ni lam dang ye shes kyi dmigs pa nyid gcig pu ste gnas yin zhing gcig la gcig brten pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says: the limit of reality is the sole objective support of the path and intuition, i.e. it is the basis, and is described as mutually dependent.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i lam la bya'o //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i lam la bya'o //
translated: The so-called path refers to the path subsumed by the level of action in faith.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Intuition refers to the path of seeing.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The limit of reality is thusness.

original: lam dang ye shes gnyis ka'i dmigs pa yang de gcig pu'o //
analyzed: lam dang ye shes gnyis ka'i dmigs pa yang de gcig pu'o //
translated: That alone is the object of both the path and the intuition.

original: @97b gcig ni mos pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: @97b gcig ni mos pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: One is by the power of aspiration.

original: cig shos ni mngon sum du byed pa ste khyad par ni de'o //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir gnas te /
analyzed: cig shos ni mngon sum du byed pa ste khyad par ni de'o // gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir gnas te /
translated: The other is by direct realization. This is the difference.

original: ye shes kyi rgyu ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i lam mo zhes khong nas byung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyu ni mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa'i lam mo zhes khong nas byung ngo //
translated: Since it is so, therefore, the cause of intuition is the path included in the stage of action in faith.

original: de ni 'di skad du lam zag pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du lam zag pa dang bcas /
translated: This is what is meant: the path is with outflows and with aspects.

original: rnam pa dang bcas te 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang stong pa nyid la mos pas tshad ma grogs su gyur pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas te 'khrul pa yin du zin kyang stong pa nyid la mos pas tshad ma grogs su gyur pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur te /
translated: Even though it is mistaken, it is the cause of non-erroneous intuition, because it is the companion of valid knowledge, by virtue of aspiration for emptiness.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don gang la mos pa de ni lam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don gang la mos pa de ni lam ste /
translated: Thus, that which is called emptiness is the object of aspiration, and that is the path.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid yin pas don dam par yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid yin pas don dam par yod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is the nature of the other-dependent, it is taught that it exists ultimately.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ye shes gnas dang / lhan cig phan tshun rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa des ni ye shes ni ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ye shes gnas dang / lhan cig phan tshun rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa des ni ye shes ni ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because in this way, the wisdom and the abode are mutually causes and effects, therefore, the wisdom is said to be endowed,

original: mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: not non-endowed.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not devoid of the nature of cause and effect.

original: ye shes ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig la /
analyzed: ye shes ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo'i tshig la /
translated: The wisdom is said to be endowed with abandonment, etc., in the words of the sutra.

original: ye shes ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa la dgongs so //
analyzed: ye shes ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa la dgongs so //
translated: Here, the wisdom is intended to be included in the uncontaminated path of cultivation.

original: 'dor bas na spong ba ste kun gzhi zhes bya bas na nyes pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dor bas na spong ba ste kun gzhi zhes bya bas na nyes pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is abandonment because it is discarded, and it is the basis because it is the cause of faults.

original: 'dir yang 'bru mang po dang / de'i skyes bu'i tshul gyis don gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bru mang po dang / de'i skyes bu'i tshul gyis don gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two meanings by the method of many grains and its person:

original: spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa ni ye shes gang gis bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa ni ye shes gang gis bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Endowed with abandonment is the wisdom by which it is generated. It is called that.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes la gnas te gnas 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes la gnas te gnas 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do /
translated: It is said that it is the transformation of the basis, since it is based on the intuition of the reality limit.

original: sa bcus bsdus pa yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes de nyid ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: sa bcus bsdus pa yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes de nyid ni gzhi ste /
translated: That intuition of the reality limit subsumed by the ten stages is the basis,

original: des kun gzhi zhes bya ba gnas gyur nas nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kun gzhi zhes bya ba gnas gyur nas nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is called the store-consciousness, and when it is transformed, it is free from faults.

original: nam de'i skyes bu'i tshul du gyur pa de'i tshe ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nam de'i skyes bu'i tshul du gyur pa de'i tshe ni spong ba dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
translated: When it becomes the person's way of being, then it is endowed with abandonment,

original: gnas gyur pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: since it is generated by the transformation.

original: don ni de'o //
analyzed: don ni de'o //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ni gnas gyur pas ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gnas gyur pas ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: It is said that it is the intuition that is extremely pure by the transformation.

original: sa bcu par rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa des sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu par rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa des sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa 'byung ngo //
translated: At the time of the vajra-like concentration on the tenth stage, the transformation of the store-consciousness is such that the extremely pure intuition subsumed by the stage of Buddha is generated.

original: de nyid kyi mjug sdud ni phan tshun bya bas byas par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi mjug sdud ni phan tshun bya bas byas par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The summary of that is: ‚ÄúIt is called the mutual performance of action.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang dag par ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i sgra'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dag par ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i sgra'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúendowed‚Äù and ‚Äúnot endowed‚Äù is as before.

original: ye shes @98a * //üîΩzhes bya ba ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan te /üîΩde'i bshad pa ni shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes @98a * // zhes bya ba ni phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan te / de'i bshad pa ni shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Knowledge.üîΩThis is taught by ‚Äúskill in the aggregates‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe explanation of that is: ‚ÄúThe correct understanding of things that are objects of knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni shes bya ba yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa ni yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'dir ni shes bya ba yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtson pa ni yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is that one is striving to correctly understand objects of knowledge.

original: bzlog pa ni mi ldan pa'i don to //üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes rab tu dbye ba brjod do //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mi ldan pa'i don to // gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes rab tu dbye ba brjod do //
translated: The opposite is the meaning of ‚Äúnot endowed.‚Äù

original: rgyu shes pa ni sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu shes pa ni sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is a cause is the knowledge of the seed of liberation of sentient beings.

original: de ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: de ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi thar pa'i sa bon dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: That is called the thorough understanding that is the seed of liberation for sentient beings who have been in cyclic existence without beginning.

original: las sna tshogs kyi rnam par smin pa de dang mthun par yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'bras bu shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: las sna tshogs kyi rnam par smin pa de dang mthun par yongs su shes pa 'di ni 'bras bu shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This thorough understanding of the maturation of various actions in accordance with their causes is called the knowledge of results.

original: don shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúknowledge of objects‚Äù

original: don ni phan pa ste de ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: don ni phan pa ste de ni shes pa'o //
translated: means benefit, and that is what is known.

original: de ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa dang mthun pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as the thorough understanding that is in accordance with benefit for oneself and benefit for others.

original: thabs shes pa ni gang gis dge ba chung du yang shin tu rgyas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thabs shes pa ni gang gis dge ba chung du yang shin tu rgyas par byed pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of means is that by which even a small wholesome action is greatly extended

original: 'khor ba ji srid par mi zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par mi zad par byed pa'o //
translated: and made inexhaustible for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: shes rab shes pa ni gang gis dge ba chung du yang de ltar stobs dang ldan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab shes pa ni gang gis dge ba chung du yang de ltar stobs dang ldan par byed pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of wisdom is that by which even a small wholesome action is made so powerfulüîΩthat it is inexhaustible for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: gang gis 'khor ba'i skyon shin tu chen pos kyang zil gyis mi non par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'khor ba'i skyon shin tu chen pos kyang zil gyis mi non par byed pa'o //
translated: by which one is not overwhelmed by the great faults of cyclic existence.

original: de bas na tshig de gnyis kyis bshad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du yang tshad med par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na tshig de gnyis kyis bshad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du yang tshad med par byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the explanation of those two terms is: ‚Äúeven small roots of virtue are made immeasurable.

original: shin tu rgyas pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù They are not overwhelmed by the discordances with the vaipulya.

original: de la thabs kyi stobs kyis ni shin tu rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de la thabs kyi stobs kyis ni shin tu rgyas pa'o //
translated: Therein, the vaipulya is by the power of means.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: The lack of being overwhelmed is by the power of wisdom.

original: 'di ni chos 'di la skal ba yod pas bsdu bar 'os so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos 'di la skal ba yod pas bsdu bar 'os so //
translated: This is the knowledge of the suitability of attracting those who have the fortune for this Dharma.üîΩThis is not for those who do not have the fortune.

original: 'di ni skal ba med pas ma yin pa'o zhes shes pa gang yin pa de ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skal ba med pas ma yin pa'o zhes shes pa gang yin pa de ni bsdu ba shes pa'o //
translated: That which knows this is the knowledge of attraction.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the analysis of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the perfections is the thorough knowledge of the divisions of generosity and so on.

original: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by the statement: ‚Äúthe thorough knowledge of the various elements just as they are. ‚Äù

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de las sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de las sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Element‚Äù means that buddhahood arises from that,

original: tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, it is the ‚Äúcollection. ‚Äù

original: sbyin @98b pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa la sogs pa tha dad pas rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin @98b pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa la sogs pa tha dad pas rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of generosity and so on is the collection of merit and knowledge, which is various due to the different types of generosity, such as giving material things, fearlessness, and the Dharma.

original: snying rje chen po shes pa ni gang gis sems can bsod nams la 'jug pa dang / bsod nams ma yin pa las 'byin pa ste ;
analyzed: snying rje chen po shes pa ni gang gis sems can bsod nams la 'jug pa dang / bsod nams ma yin pa las 'byin pa ste ;
translated: The knowledge of great compassion is that by which one engages sentient beings in merit and turns them away from demerit.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained by the statement: ‚Äúthe engagement in and disengagement from virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas. ‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
translated: When one brings sentient beings to full maturity,

original: de shas pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de shas pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: that knowledge is the knowledge of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de ni dus dang dus ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dus dang dus ma yin pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúthe discernment of what is timely and untimely.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par mngon par zhen pa med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs par mngon par zhen pa med par shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the non-fixation on all things‚Äù is the knowledge of the non-fixation on the superimposition and denial of unreal, imagined things.

original: de ni mtha' gnyis spangs nas nang la brten pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni mtha' gnyis spangs nas nang la brten pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúthe avoidance of the two extremes and the reliance on the middle.‚Äù

original: nang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par rig pa tsam du ston to //
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par rig pa tsam du ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmiddle‚Äù indicates mere representation.

original: mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs nas rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrtsom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni go cha'i brtson 'grus nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs nas rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rtsom pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni go cha'i brtson 'grus nyid la bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should cultivate mere representation by avoiding the two extremes.üîΩThe word ‚Äúundertaking‚Äù should be understood as referring to the armor-like effort.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni 'og nas sbyor ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni 'og nas sbyor ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The application-type effort is mentioned below in the verse-text with the word ‚Äúapplication.‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi lus kyi las yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni lus kyi rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi lus kyi las yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni lus kyi rtsom pa ste /
translated: The undertaking of body is the undertaking of the purification of one's own and others' physical actions.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The phrase all sentient beings is stated.

original: thams cad ces pa'i tshig gis ni bdag kyang bsdus so //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa'i tshig gis ni bdag kyang bsdus so //
translated: The word all includes oneself.

original: ngag gi rtsom pa dang / sems kyi rtsom pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rtsom pa dang / sems kyi rtsom pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The undertaking of speech and the undertaking of mind should be understood in the same way.

original: gsum po 'di dag gis bshad pa ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag gis bshad pa ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of these three is that one who has undertaken striving is free from the misdeeds of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for others as well,

original: logs shig tu smos pas lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyis bdag la bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: logs shig tu smos pas lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyis bdag la bya bar mngon no //
translated: the phrase as well indicates that the meaning of free from the misdeeds of body, etc. is understood to apply to oneself.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni go cha bgos pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni go cha bgos pa'o //
translated: One who has undertaken striving is one who has donned the armor.

original: bslab pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: bslab pa de nyid la zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: The phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.

original: nang du so sor brtags pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni nang gi rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: nang du so sor brtags pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni nang gi rtsom pa ste /
translated: The phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.

original: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ro gcig par nang las so sor rtog par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //üîΩbsgom pa la brten nas sems can @99a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du ro gcig par nang las so sor rtog par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o // bsgom pa la brten nas sems can @99a * //
translated: The phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.

original: rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pa yin te /üîΩsems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnams la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pa yin te / sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.

original: de'i bshad pa ni bsgom pa la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba bor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni bsgom pa la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba bor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.üîΩThe phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training refers to the characteristic of being free from the misdeeds of body, etc.

original: sems can rnams la mthun par chos bstan pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni phyi'i rtsom pa ste /üîΩsems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la mthun par chos bstan pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni phyi'i rtsom pa ste /üîΩsems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase internal effort refers to the effort that is directed internally.üîΩThe phrase in that training

original: 'dul pa dang 'tshams par chos ston pa ni mtshungs par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul pa dang 'tshams par chos ston pa ni mtshungs par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Teaching the Dharma in accordance with the Vinaya is the composition of the same.

original: de'i bshad pa ni 'khor ba ma rungs pa ma yin pa gdams pa zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni 'khor ba ma rungs pa ma yin pa gdams pa zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The explanation of that is called the instruction of the non-evil cycle.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa yongs su 'tshal ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni ye shes kyi rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i thos pa yongs su 'tshal ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni ye shes kyi rtsom pa ste /
translated: The composition of wisdom is the undertaking for the sake of understanding the undistorted hearing.

original: phyin ci ma log par theg pa chen po thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par dag ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par theg pa chen po thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnam par dag ste / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha is purified by the stages of hearing and contemplating the Great Vehicle without distortion.

original: de'i bshad pa ni ma nor bar thos pa yongs su btsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni ma nor bar thos pa yongs su btsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called the search for undistorted hearing.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni zhing gi rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni zhing gi rtsom pa ste /
translated: The composition of the field is the undertaking for the sake of purifying the Buddha field.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyi yon tan bkod pa sna tshogs su gnas pa de dag kun tu bstan pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyi yon tan bkod pa sna tshogs su gnas pa de dag kun tu bstan pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the various arrays of good qualities of the Buddha-fields are all present in that, the consciousnesses of those to be trained are transformed into the perception of those arrays.

original: bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are generated.

original: de ni 'di skad du pha rol na sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba ci yang med kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du pha rol na sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba ci yang med kyi /
translated: This is what is being said: There is nothing at all that is called a ‚ÄúBuddha-field‚Äù over there.

original: rnam par shes pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar nye bar byas pa thams cad la dbang sgyur bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig rgyud rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa la ltos nas sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes ston par
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar nye bar byas pa thams cad la dbang sgyur bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig rgyud rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa la ltos nas sna tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes ston par
translated: Consciousness, which is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, is the cause of the various appearances of the world, which are nothing but the mastery of all that is created, in dependence on the purity or impurity of the continuum.

original: 'gyur ro // de bas na de ni chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bas na de ni chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is called ‚Äúthe mastery of all phenomena.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i rtsom pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i rtsom pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The composition for the sake of knowing the thoughts and propensities of sentient beings is the composition for the sake of maturing sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi gnyen po 'tsham par chos ston pa ni sman shes shing chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi gnyen po 'tsham par chos ston pa ni sman shes shing chos ston pa ste /
translated: Having known their thoughts and propensities, one teaches the Dharma as the appropriate antidote to the disease of the afflictions. This is the knowledge of the medicine and the teaching of the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi sman yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi sman yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The composition for the sake of knowing the medicine for the disease of the afflictions is stated.

original: don gyis na bstan par bsdus par blta ste /
analyzed: don gyis na bstan par bsdus par blta ste /
translated: In fact, it should be seen as included in the teaching.

original: yongs su shes pa ni de'i phyed kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni de'i phyed kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the knowledge of that, it is the composition for the sake of knowing the medicine for the disease of the afflictions.

original: de bas na bshad pa @99b las bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas ji ltar mthun par chos ston pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa @99b las bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes nas ji ltar mthun par chos ston pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, in the explanation, it is stated: ‚ÄúHaving known their thoughts and propensities, one teaches the Dharma as the appropriate antidote.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: Thought is intention.

original: bag la nyal ba ni sa bon no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni sa bon no //
translated: Propensities are seeds.

original: de kho na khong du chud par bya ba'i rtsom pa ni de kho na'i rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na khong du chud par bya ba'i rtsom pa ni de kho na'i rtsom pa ste /
translated: The composition for the sake of understanding reality is the composition for the sake of reality.

original: de ni de kho na khong du chud par bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni de kho na khong du chud par bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as the realization of reality.

original: de kho na khong du chud na sangs rgyas nyid du nges pa'i phung po la zhugs pa yin pa'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na khong du chud na sangs rgyas nyid du nges pa'i phung po la zhugs pa yin pa'i phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
