translated: When one realizes reality, one enters the aggregate that is certain to become buddhahood.

original: mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis gzhan du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis gzhan du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes te /
translated: The knowledge of the unconditioned is that which does not change for those who are attached.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rtsom pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rtsom pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rtsom pa ste /
translated: The undertaking of its completion is the undertaking of the completion of the knowledge of the unconditioned.

original: de'i bshad pa ni sems la yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni sems la yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is the abandonment of the grasping of the mind as real and unreal.

original: de kho na ma mthong ba rnams ni ji ltar snang ba de kho na bzhin du sems de kho na'o zhes yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: de kho na ma mthong ba rnams ni ji ltar snang ba de kho na bzhin du sems de kho na'o zhes yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: Those who do not see reality grasp the mind as reality just as it appears.

original: gnyis las dben pa'i ngo bor ni med do zhes yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin to //
analyzed: gnyis las dben pa'i ngo bor ni med do zhes yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin to //
translated: It does not exist as the nature of the separation of the two.

original: de ltar yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin par 'dzin pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: Thus, having completely abandoned the grasping of the real and the unreal,

original: dbu ma'i lam la gnas na srid pa thams cad la sems mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam la gnas na srid pa thams cad la sems mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: when one abides in the middle way, one is free from the mind's attachment to all existence.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that all three realms and so on.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'am pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'am pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of the perfections or the application of the perfections is the application of the perfections.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la'ang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la'ang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the following.

original: de'i bshad pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is called the completion of the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: The application of the means of gathering is the branch of ripening sentient beings.

original: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained by ripening sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni chos rnams kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni chos rnams kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the application of wisdom is the thorough investigation of the origination and cessation of things.

original: thabs kyi sbyor ba ni chos thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur bas de chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: thabs kyi sbyor ba ni chos thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur bas de chos thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: The explanation of the application of means is the skill in all things, because one becomes skilled in all things.

original: snying rje chen po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the application of great compassion is the absence of desire for nirvana.

original: snying rje chen pos sems can gyi don la brtson pas nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sems can gyi don la brtson pas nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of great compassion, one strives for the welfare of sentient beings and does not desire nirvana like the Sravakas.

original: bsod nams nyid tshogs te /
analyzed: bsod nams nyid tshogs te /
translated: Merit is the collection,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsod @100a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsod @100a * //
translated: because it is the cause of the qualities of a Buddha.üîΩMerit is the cause of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: nams yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba ni bsod nams bsags pa la brten pas mthu che ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba dang gzhan dag gis zil gyis mi non te /
analyzed: nams yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba ni bsod nams bsags pa la brten pas mthu che ba'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba dang gzhan dag gis zil gyis mi non te /
translated: The application of seeking merit is not overcome by the wheel-turning kings and others because it is powerful, being based on the accumulation of merit.

original: thams cad du 'jigs pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'jigs pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is fearless because it is fearless in all situations.

original: de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúhe attains the four forms of fearlessness.‚Äù

original: 'jigs pa med pas mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pas mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is the absence of fear.

original: yul tha dad pas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yul tha dad pas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four types, according to the object.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar du gcod pa bstan pa dang / lam bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / bar du gcod pa bstan pa dang / lam bshad pa'o //
translated: They are the complete enlightenment with regard to all things, the destruction of all the impurities, the teaching of the obstacles to that , and the explanation of the path to that .

original: de yang mdo sde las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du rnam pa bzhir khong du chud par bya'o//
analyzed: de yang mdo sde las ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du rnam pa bzhir khong du chud par bya'o//
translated: And these should be understood as they are described in the sutras.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni shes rab kyi sbyor bar gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i shes rab sgrub pa'i phyir rtsom pa ni shes rab kyi sbyor bar gsungs so //
translated: The application of wisdom is said to be the beginning of the wisdom that engages with objects through the process of mental construction.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba ste 'di ni bye brag go //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba'i sbyor ba ste 'di ni bye brag go //
translated: The application of the accumulation of knowledge is the application to the entrance without fabrication. This is the distinction.

original: de bas na chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes thob pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the attainment of spontaneous knowledge of all phenomena.

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la som nyi med par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bsam pa rnam par sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la som nyi med par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bsam pa rnam par sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application for the sake of being without doubt regarding the truths, jewels, and so forth is the application of purifying the attitude.

original: de ni chos thams cad la the tshom med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad la the tshom med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as being without doubt regarding all phenomena.

original: bden pa ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The truth is the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bden pa rnam par dpyad pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bden pa rnam par dpyad pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application for the sake of comprehending that is the application of analyzing the truths.

original: de ltar sbyor na stong pa nyid khong du chud pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la rim bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bas mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor na stong pa nyid khong du chud pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnams la rim bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bas mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if one practices in this way, one becomes free from attachment, by being free from the sequence of attachment and aversion to the pleasant and unpleasant, through understanding emptiness.

original: sbyor ba'i don bcu pa gzung bar 'gyur bas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i don bcu pa gzung bar 'gyur bas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The tenth stage of practice is stated as ‚Äúnon-attachment to all the pleasant and unpleasant,‚Äù because one has attained it.

original: de bas na tshig gnyis bsdus na don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pas mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na tshig gnyis bsdus na don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pas mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Thus, if one condenses the two phrases, one explains ‚Äúnon-attachment‚Äù by ‚Äúentering into the way of the ultimate.‚Äù

original: don dam pa ni stong pa nyid do /
analyzed: don dam pa ni stong pa nyid do /
translated: The ultimate is emptiness.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dren par byed thob par byed pas tshul lo //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dren par byed thob par byed pas tshul lo //
translated: That itself is the way, because it leads to and obtains the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de la 'jug pa ni khong du chud pa ste ;
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni khong du chud pa ste ;
translated: Entering into that is understanding.

original: 'dis bden pa rnam par dpyad pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis bden pa rnam par dpyad pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de bshad do //
translated: This explains the phrase ‚Äúthe stage of analysis of the truths.‚Äù

original: mngon par zhen par med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gong du bsgom pa la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba bor zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang 'di'i don mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gong du bsgom pa la brten nas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba bor zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang 'di'i don mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of non-attachment is as before. This means that the meaning of this is the same as what was explained above, ‚Äúhaving relied on meditation, one abandons attachment and aversion.‚Äù

original: 'dis @100b ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis @100b ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig bshad do //
translated: This explains the term ‚Äúapplication to non-attachment to all that is attractive and unattractive.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig rnam pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyis ye shes 'khor dang bcas pa bshad do //
translated: Thus, in this way, the wisdom together with its retinue is explained in thirty-three aspects.

original: ye shes de lta bu la goms pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: ye shes de lta bu la goms pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is familiar with such wisdom is distinguished by wisdom.

original: de ni don gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning.

original: da ni ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'i don de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar khong du chud par byed pa'i don de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of how one should understand this, it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mi zad pa la rtog pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mi zad pa la rtog pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas have ten contemplations of inexhaustibility.

original: sems can gyi lus ma lus pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa ni lus mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi lus ma lus pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa ni lus mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
translated: The contemplation of the inexhaustibility of the body is the contemplation of the bodies of all sentient beings without exception.

original: de ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi lus la rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi lus la rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the contemplation of the bodies of the noble and non-noble, the conditioned and unconditioned.

original: bden pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lus go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba rnams dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lus go rims bzhin no //
translated: The bodies of those who have seen the truth and those who have not seen it, and the bodies of those who are not noble, respectively.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus ni 'dus byas te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus ni 'dus byas te /
translated: The body that arises from the ripening of karma is conditioned.

original: las rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is fully formed by karmas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The body that is transformed by the buddhas and bodhisattvas has the characteristic of being unconditioned.

original: 'dis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du yang ma lus par bya ba la lta'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du yang ma lus par bya ba la lta'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù should be understood as referring to everything.

original: sems ni dngos po ste /
analyzed: sems ni dngos po ste /
translated: The mind is the entity.

original: de tsam du zad pa'i phyir dngos po'o //üîΩde la rtog pa ni dngos po mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de tsam du zad pa'i phyir dngos po'o // de la rtog pa ni dngos po mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
translated: It is an entity because it is just that much.üîΩThe conception of it is the conception of the inexhaustible entity.

original: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Its explanation is called the conception of the real and the unreal.

original: gnyis la mngon par zhen pa las dben pa ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis la mngon par zhen pa las dben pa ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: The real is the separation from attachment to duality.

original: sems phyin ci log pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The unreal is the perversion of the mind.

original: 'dis ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the application of mindfulness to the mind.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni chos mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni chos mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind is the conception of the inexhaustible entity.

original: de'i bshad pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is called the conception of the small, middling, and great addictions and purifications.

original: tshor ba'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sred pa mi zad pa la rtog pa'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: tshor ba'i sgo nas sred pa 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sred pa mi zad pa la rtog pa'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of feeling is explained as the expression of the understanding of the inexhaustibility of craving, because craving arises from feeling.

original: de'i bshad pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sred pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sred pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its explanation is the understanding of craving for the wholesome and the unwholesome.

original: 'khor ba'i bde ba la 'dod pa ni mi dge ba'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bde ba la 'dod pa ni mi dge ba'i sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for the happiness of cyclic existence is unwholesome.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: Craving for the happiness of nirvana is wholesome.
View

original: ba mi zad pa la rtog pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
analyzed: ba mi zad pa la rtog pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
translated: The remaining expressions of the understanding of the inexhaustibility of view and so on should be regarded as the classifications of the establishments of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa'i lta ba ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro btags pa'i lta ba ni phyin ci log go //
translated: View is the superimposition of an unreal nature.

original: bzlog pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is nonerroneous.

original: de ni lta ba mi zad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lta ba mi zad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the expression the understanding of the inexhaustibility of view.

original: tshogs mi zad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sgo sna tshogs nas bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs mi zad pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni sgo sna tshogs nas bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is that it is the investigation of the roots of virtue that have been accumulated through various doors.

original: sems can rnams kyi khams kyi nye bar len par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi khams kyi nye bar len par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las te /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is the basis for the appropriation of the afflictions and karma of sentient beings.

original: de ni sems can rnams kyi khams mtha' yas pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams kyi khams mtha' yas pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: It is infinite because the realm of sentient beings is infinite.

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is that it is the investigation of the infinite realm of sentient beings.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of non-attachment is as before, that is, it is the application of non-attachment to all that is attractive and unattractive.

original: de'i bshad pa ni don dang don ma yin pa dang ldan pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni don dang don ma yin pa dang ldan pa la rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is that it is the investigation of what is meaningful and what is not meaningful.

original: byang chub kyi snying po ni byang chub kyi shing ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po ni byang chub kyi shing ste /
translated: The seat of enlightenment is the tree of enlightenment.

original: de kun tu ston pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de kun tu ston pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: To manifest that is knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de mi zad pa ni mos pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su ston pa'i phyir de ltar rtog pa ni byang chub kyi snying po shes pa mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi de mi zad pa ni mos pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su ston pa'i phyir de ltar rtog pa ni byang chub kyi snying po shes pa mi zad pa la rtog pa ste /
translated: The buddhas' inexhaustibility is shown as various by the power of different aspirations. Thus, the realization of the inexhaustibility of the knowledge of the essence of enlightenment is the realization of the essence of enlightenment.

original: de ni mos pa tha dad pa'i sems can la byang chub kyi snying po kun tu ston pa la rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni mos pa tha dad pa'i sems can la byang chub kyi snying po kun tu ston pa la rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the realization of the essence of enlightenment for sentient beings with different aspirations.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi rnam par dag pa rnams ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci nas 'dul ba'i phyir dngos po bcu ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi rnam par dag pa rnams ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci nas 'dul ba'i phyir dngos po bcu ste /
translated: The purities of the ten perfections are the ten things for the sake of subduing whatever is their resistance.

original: de dag ni ser sna'i sems 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de dag ni ser sna'i sems 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: They are indicated by the words the mind of stinginess is subdued, and so on.

original: de'i bshad pa ni gang gi don du khong du chud par byed pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni gang gi don du khong du chud par byed pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is that which is to be understood for the sake of... and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir khong du chud par byed do //
translated: One understands for the sake of purifying generosity and so on.

original: byams pa bsgoms pas khong khro ba'i sems 'dul ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: byams pa bsgoms pas khong khro ba'i sems 'dul ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the mind of anger is subdued by the cultivation of loving-kindness indicates the purity of the perfection of tolerance.

original: 'khor ba mi gtong yang thabs gang gis lam gyi tshogs pa de lam gyi tshogs de bskyed pa'i thabs de 'khor ba na gnas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul lo //
analyzed: 'khor ba mi gtong yang thabs gang gis lam gyi tshogs pa de lam gyi tshogs de bskyed pa'i thabs de 'khor ba na gnas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul lo //
translated: Even though one does not abandon samsara, by what means does one generate that collection of the path? The means of generating that collection of the path is the subduing of the addictions while remaining in samsara.

original: 'dis ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates the purity of the perfection of means.

original: bden pa rnams ni sdug bsngal la @101b sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams ni sdug bsngal la @101b sogs pa ste /
translated: The truths are the truths of suffering, etc.

original: de dang de dag shes pa gang gis yang dag par sogs pa yongs su gcod pa de bden pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: de dang de dag shes pa gang gis yang dag par sogs pa yongs su gcod pa de bden pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The collection of the truths is that by which one eliminates the collection of those truths through the knowledge of those truths.

original: de sogs pa de nyid gnyen po ste 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: de sogs pa de nyid gnyen po ste 'dul ba'o //
translated: That very elimination is the antidote, the subduing.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The reality of that is that very reality.

original: de yang ji lta bus 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bus 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how does that occur?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bskyed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bskyed pas zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: The phrase by generating the unerring path indicates that.

original: / smon lam gyi khyad par gang gis phyin ci ma log pa'i lam 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / smon lam gyi khyad par gang gis phyin ci ma log pa'i lam 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The special prayer is so called because it takes up birth in accordance with the appearance of the unerring path.

original: 'dis ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of prayer.

original: lhag ma dag ni go sla bas ma sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni go sla bas ma sbyar ro //
translated: The rest is easy to understand, so I will not comment on it.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dul ba'i sa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i bshad pa ni gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dul ba'i sa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i bshad pa ni gang du gnas te khong du chud par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, moreover, these ten are the grounds of self-discipline for bodhisattva mahasattvas. The explanation of this and so on is where one abides and what one comprehends.

original: sdom pa rnam pa gsum ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdom pa rnam pa gsum ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa'i phyir te /
translated: The three kinds of vows are the vows of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Because of their purity.

original: de ni lus dul ba nyid la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis bshad do //
analyzed: de ni lus dul ba nyid la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis bshad do //
translated: That is explained by the three phrases of self-discipline of body and so on.

original: nang dul ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi bshad pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang dul ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi bshad pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the words of the sutra, ‚Äútamed within,‚Äù and so on, is ‚Äúabandoning the grasping of self.‚Äù

original: smad pa dang bsngags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni phyi rol gyi yul dul ba nyid dang de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs so
analyzed: smad pa dang bsngags pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po dag la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni phyi rol gyi yul dul ba nyid dang de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs so
translated: The absence of attachment to the eight worldly dharmas, such as praise and blame, is ‚Äútaming external objects.‚Äù Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin the manner of non-attachment to all phenomena.‚Äù

original: // de'i bshad pa ni smad pa dang ma smad pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // de'i bshad pa ni smad pa dang ma smad pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúabandoning blame and non-blame.‚Äù

original: smad pa dang ma smad pa smos pa ni mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa dang ma smad pa smos pa ni mtshon pa'o //
translated: The mention of blame and non-blame is an illustration.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs la mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid dul ba nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs la mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid dul ba nyid do //
translated: The absence of attachment to the accumulation of wisdom is itself ‚Äútaming.‚Äù

original: ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: lam la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lam la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin the manner of non-attachment to the path.‚Äù

original: de'i bshad pa ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //üîΩkun brtags pa'i ngo bos med pa'i phyir dngos po yod par mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med par mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o // kun brtags pa'i ngo bos med pa'i phyir dngos po yod par mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚ÄúThere is no attachment to existence or non-existence as entities.‚ÄùüîΩThere is no attachment to existence as entities because of the non-existence of the imagined nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos yod pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos yod pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: There is no attachment to non-existence as entities because of the existence of the perfected nature.

original: 'phags pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
translated: The noble ones are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de dag gis rnams ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de dag gis rnams ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Their thoughts are the state of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: de dag la rtog pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la rtog pa ste /üîΩde ni mi dmigs @102a * //
analyzed: de dag la rtog pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la rtog pa ste / de ni mi dmigs @102a * //
translated: Their investigation is the investigation of the nature of emptiness.

original: pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa la so sor rtog pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù and ‚Äúthe discernment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: de ltar so sor rtog na bdag la stod par mi byed de /
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog na bdag la stod par mi byed de /
translated: When one investigates in that way, one does not praise oneself.

original: de bas na de bdag la bstod pa dul ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de bdag la bstod pa dul ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one becomes disciplined in that self-praise.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyun to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyun to //
translated: The future limit is the continuity of future births.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Its purification is nirvana,

original: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: which is characterized by the transformation of the basis.

original: de yongs su sbyong ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba ste /
analyzed: de yongs su sbyong ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba ste /
translated: Its thorough knowledge is the abandonment of all conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conceptualization is the affliction of the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bar gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te der 'byung zhing de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral bar gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te der 'byung zhing de'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: The state of being free from all conceptualization is the state of the perfection of wisdom, which is the state of the bodhisattva.

original: de'i bshad pa ni 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is the freedom from all grasping.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten te bshad pa ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten te bshad pa ni tha snyad do //
translated: The conventional is the explanation based on the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: de la shin tu yongs su dul ba nyid de ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la shin tu yongs su dul ba nyid de ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there complete self-control in that?

original: sems can thams cad la mi bslu ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mi bslu ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a manner that is undeceptive to all sentient beings‚Äù is stated.

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa ni mi bslu ba ste /
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa ston pa ni mi bslu ba ste /
translated: The teaching of conventional and ultimate reality in accordance with the fortune of the disciple is undeceptive.

original: de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa la mkhas pas phyin ci ma log pa'i lam ston pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe teaching of the unerring path by one who is skilled in the conventional and the ultimate.‚Äù

original: lus dang sems la mi lta ba dul ba nyid ces bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi bshad pa ni sems can 'dul ba'i phyir skye ba thams cad la mi skyo bas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems la mi lta ba dul ba nyid ces bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi bshad pa ni sems can 'dul ba'i phyir skye ba thams cad la mi skyo bas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the words of the sutra ‚Äúself-control through disregard for body and mind‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause of not being discouraged by all births in order to discipline sentient beings.‚Äù

original: tshig gi dngos po kho na ni tshig tsam nyid de /
analyzed: tshig gi dngos po kho na ni tshig tsam nyid de /
translated: The mere words are the mere words.

original: mdo'i cha 'di'i bshad pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos grub ba ni mi bslu bas yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdo'i cha 'di'i bshad pa ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos grub ba ni mi bslu bas yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this part of the sutra is ‚Äúthe establishment of the Dharma that is in accord with the teaching that is undeceptive.‚Äù

original: lam sgrub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: lam sgrub pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: The practice of the path is the actualization of the paths of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe actualization of the Disciple and Solitary Buddha vehicles.‚Äù

original: spong ba sgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mngon sum du byas pa la yang 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba sgrub pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam mngon sum du byas pa la yang 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of abandonment is the absence of any desire for the actualization of the Disciple and other vehicles.

original: de ni de dag la 'dod pa med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni de dag la 'dod pa med pa zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe absence of any desire for those.‚Äù

original: yang bdag nyid lam bzang por zhugs pa dang gzhan dag la yang lam de ston pa zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dul ba'i sgrub pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang bdag nyid lam bzang por zhugs pa dang gzhan dag la yang lam de ston pa zhes bya ba ni bdag 'dul ba'i sgrub pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the phrase ‚Äúone who has entered the good path himself and shows that path to others‚Äù is the explanation of the accomplishment of self-discipline and the accomplishment of the spiritual ripening of living beings, respectively.

original: rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i shes @102b pas sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rnam par gnas par mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i shes @102b pas sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rnam par gnas par mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe accomplishment of knowledge with effort‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúthe knowledge with effort of one who remains on the stage of action in faith.‚Äù

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni so so'i skye bo'i sa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni so so'i skye bo'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of action in faith is the stage of the ordinary person.

original: spyod pa'i sa ni sa bdun po dag go //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa ni sa bdun po dag go //
translated: The stages of practice are the seven stages.üîΩThe stage of spontaneous accomplishment is the eighth stage.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis grub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis grub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of this is that the path of meditation is the stage of spontaneous accomplishment by the knowledge that is effortless.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pas bsdus pa ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam du blta'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pas bsdus pa ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam du blta'o //
translated: The path of meditation is to be understood as including the eighth stage and so on.

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas par sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas par sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the establishment of the stages of skill is

original: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: skill in wisdom and method.

original: sa dbyer med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ste /
analyzed: sa dbyer med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ste /
translated: The indivisibility of the stages is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de'i bshad pa ni mtshan nyid gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni mtshan nyid gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is that they are included in the single characteristic.

original: sa'i nyes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ste yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i nyes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ste yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: The faults of the stages are the adherence to subject and object, which are to be abandoned.

original: de ni gnyis la kun tu spyod pa yongs su spong ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gnyis la kun tu spyod pa yongs su spong ba zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe abandonment of the practice of duality. ‚Äù

original: sa nas sar 'phar ba ni sa snga ma las sa phyi mar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sa nas sar 'phar ba ni sa snga ma las sa phyi mar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Ascending from stage to stage is going from an earlier stage to a later stage.

original: de la mkhas pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: Skill in that is accomplishment.

original: de yang bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'gyur te de ni dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de yang bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'gyur te de ni dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams pas zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: Moreover, that is due to the path of meditative development, as is stated: ‚Äúthrough the application of striving in the meditative development of the wholesome roots‚Äù.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa bstan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yang chos thams cad legs par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa bstan pa'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni yang chos thams cad legs par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the demonstration of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels is explained as the thorough accomplishment of all the dharmas.

original: de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: Buddhahood is the stainlessness of thusness.

original: de'i byang chub khong du chud pa de las phyir mi ldog pa'i lam gang yin pa de la mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i byang chub khong du chud pa de las phyir mi ldog pa'i lam gang yin pa de la mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The path of non-retrogression in regard to the penetration of that enlightenment is accomplishment.

original: de'i bshad pa ni de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa'i bsgom pa la mkhas pas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa'i bsgom pa la mkhas pas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: ‚Äúthrough skill in the meditative development of the penetration of thusness‚Äù.

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa bzhis rgyus bsdus pa'i spyod pa rnam par dbye ba khyad par du 'phags pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa bzhis rgyus bsdus pa'i spyod pa rnam par dbye ba khyad par du 'phags pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, the four special purities teach the special analysis of the practice subsumed by the cause.

original: tshogs dang rnam par dag pa'i lam bstan pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bstan pa zhes bya bas rgya cher bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs dang rnam par dag pa'i lam bstan pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bstan pa zhes bya bas rgya cher bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught extensively by the four topics: the teaching of the path of accumulation and purification, the teaching of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, the teaching of the method for comprehending the limit of reality, and the teaching of the practice of the concordant Dharma.

original: rgyu rnam par dag pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid mngon sum du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar sgrub @103a * //üîΩpa rnams la zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam par dag pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid mngon sum du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar sgrub @103a * // pa rnams la zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: Having manifested these four special purities of the cause, the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúThus, for those who practice‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyu rnam par dag pa rnam par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyu rnam par dag pa rnam par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of the special purities of the cause is the practice of the special purities of the cause as they are taught.

original: de'i bshad pa ni rgyu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa 'di bzhis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni rgyu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa 'di bzhis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúby these four aspects of the special purity of the cause.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te 'bras bus bsdus pa'i spyod pa rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te 'bras bus bsdus pa'i spyod pa rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Supreme, perfect enlightenment is the gnosis of omniscience. The conduct included in the result has been taught.

original: de'i bshad pa ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa khyad par du 'phags par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Its explanation is to be understood as the preeminence of the purity of the result.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes dus gsum skad cig gcig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes dus gsum skad cig gcig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the gnosis of the Tathagatas endowed with the three times in a single moment.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gtso bos phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gtso bos phyin ci ma log par bstan par mdzad pas na bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Since the noble Manjusri, the chief, taught without error, the Blessed One gave his approval.

original: de ni ma nor bar bshad de ston pa'i thugs mnyes pas legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni ma nor bar bshad de ston pa'i thugs mnyes pas legs par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don du rig par bya'o zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: That is explained as being taught without error. It should be understood as meaning that the teacher was pleased with the good explanation.

original: yi rangs zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang sbyar gyi gong ma dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yi rangs zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang sbyar gyi gong ma dang ni ma yin no //
translated: The word rejoiced is to be connected with the words the youthful Manjusri, etc., and not with the preceding words.

original: ston pa po ni ston pa ste de'i rnam par dag pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ston pa po ni ston pa ste de'i rnam par dag pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The teacher is the one who teaches, and his purity has been explained.

original: bstan pa rnam par dag pa ni mdo thog thag go //
analyzed: bstan pa rnam par dag pa ni mdo thog thag go //
translated: The purity of the teaching is the entire Sutra.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: The purity of the result of the teaching is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam par dag pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa yi rangs so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis 'phags pa 'jam dpal la sogs pa yi rangs so //
translated: The noble Manjusri and the others rejoiced in these three kinds of purity.

original: mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par bstod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par bstod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They praised him, meaning that they looked at him with the meaning of such praise.

original: lta ngan kun gyi dra ba rab dral mdo sde 'grel dang bcas pa zur phyin 'di //
analyzed: lta ngan kun gyi dra ba rab dral mdo sde 'grel dang bcas pa zur phyin 'di //
translated: The net of all false views is torn by this commentary on the Sutra,

original: bshad pas bdag gis bsod nams rnam pa shin tu bstan la tshang ba gang thob des //
analyzed: bshad pas bdag gis bsod nams rnam pa shin tu bstan la tshang ba gang thob des //
translated: and by this explanation, may I attain the pure merit which the Blessed One has.

original: sems can 'dron pa mang po 'di dag sa gsum rgya mtsho'i pha rol myur bsgral te //
analyzed: sems can 'dron pa mang po 'di dag sa gsum rgya mtsho'i pha rol myur bsgral te //
translated: May they quickly cross the three worlds' ocean and

original: tshangs la sogs pas ma bgrod sangs rgyas gnas mchog dri med gang de myur thob shog //
analyzed: tshangs la sogs pas ma bgrod sangs rgyas gnas mchog dri med gang de myur thob shog //
translated: attain the immaculate state of buddhahood, which even Brahma and the rest cannot reach.

original: /'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri'i mdo dang spel mar bshad pa /
analyzed: /'phags pa ga ya mgo'i ri'i mdo dang spel mar bshad pa /
translated: The noble G·πõdhrak≈´·π≠a S≈´tra, with interspersed explanations,

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gtso bo'i zhabs la brten pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gtso bo'i zhabs la brten pa /
translated: is based on the feet of the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: mang du thos pa gnas brtan sh'akya'i blos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mang du thos pa gnas brtan sh'akya'i blos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: It was composed by the elder ≈öƒÅkyamati, who has heard much. It is complete.
